He started the business with a mind to make income to supply his family's needs. In addition to the timber business he also has a produce business, which he operates on a small scale, and he says it is a great support to the family since it gives him more income. 

He applied for three million UGX to be able to buy trees for cutting into timber logs (lumber) to sell. He has hopes of expanding the business and of becoming financially stable in the future. 

Wilber’s clients are mainly the timber traders in the same location, and these have supported him to date. His main challenge is the lack of capital, which problem he believes will be solved if the loan of three million is given.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell.

loans.name: Kheng's Group

texts.en:
Age 54, Kheng is a married father of seven children living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Cambodia. Out of his seven children, he still has four children who are in school. To support his family, Kheng has been farming rice and working as a paid worker for ten years in the village. The current business earns him about 25,000 KHR per day. 

Kheng’s group consists of three members, and he is the leader of this group. He is a second cycle client with Kiva partner, VisionFund. He has successfully used the past loan from VisionFund to better support his family and business. Now he is leading his group to seek another loan. 

Kheng wants to use his portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland. 

He hopes to increase his crop yields, and sell it for a good price to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for his farmland

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 46 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a retired government employee and is now managing their rice farm. To have a continuous source of income, Lucy engages herself in a retailing business, which is selling grocery items. She sells biscuits, drinks and other basic commodities. 

Lucy wanted to expand the products she sells to her customers. She decided to ask for a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy eggs, spices and raw ingredients to sell in the village. She's hoping that through this loan her business will continue to grow progressively.

loans.use: to buy eggs, spices and raw ingredients to sell in her village.

loans.name: Andrica

texts.en:
This is Andrica. She previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more ingredients to make peanut butter, like peanuts and sugar. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household, and business expenditures. She also has a variety store and sells rice cakes for additional income. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy more ingredients to make peanut butter, like peanuts and sugar.  

Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Andrica hopes to be more successful in business and dreams of having a happy life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more ingredients in making peanut butter, like peanuts and sugar.

loans.name: Kidindimya Tweyambe Group

texts.en:
John is a 54-year-old man, married with 6 children, living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a member of Village bank where each member guarantees the others to get a loan. John has been in a carpentry business for 13 years, and with the income he has been able to build a house and also pay school fees for his children. 

The high cost of timber and inadequate capital to hire enough labor affect his business, since the demand for furniture is overwhelming, while his desire is to own a modern workshop in the town center. 

A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University, and also to set up a number of income generating activities to secure the future. John is requesting a loan to buy timber to use. Some of the members did not take the loan but because it's a group policy they appear in the photo to guarantee the others.

loans.use: to buy timber to use.

loans.name: Aharon

texts.en: Aharon is a young farmer from Jrapi village in the Shirak region. He lives with his mother and grandmother. Despite his young age, Aharon is extensively involved in agribusiness. With the help of his mother, he is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding sheep, and cultivating wheat, potatoes, alfalfa, and apples. He sells these agricultural products in the local market, which is the only source of income for the family. To continue running his agribusiness in a sustainable way, Aharon needs a loan of USD 2500 to purchase two steers, three sheep, and wheat seeds and to make previous credit repayments. Aharon and his family members will highly appreciate the lenders' support and will be grateful for their goodwill in helping them to maintain and develop their agribusiness with the help of this loan.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is an experienced farmer from Krasar village of the Shirak region. He has a large family and lives with his wife, three sons (23, 21 and 20 years old) and two daughters (16 and 4 years old). Samvel's middle son is a labor migrant in Russia; he works there and sends some money to the family to take care of their needs. 

To be able to cover the growing needs of his family, Samvel is engaged in cattle breeding, aviculture, breeding sheep, and cultivating wheat. With the help of his sons, he sells the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of their income. To get prepared for the winter, Samvel needs to make some investments in his agribusiness. He needs a loan of USD 2000 to purchase forage for the livestock, to buy wheat seeds, to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery, and to make previous credit repayments. Samvel and his big family rely on the goodwill of the lenders and will be grateful for their help in securing this loan.

loans.use: to purchase forage, wheat seeds, and fuel for agricultural machinery and to make previous credit repayments

loans.name: Sophy's Group

texts.en:
Sophy is 31 years old and married with three dependent children. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items and raising pigs while her husband is a paid worker. The current business earns her family about 70,000KHR per day to feed their children. 

Sophy’s group consists of two members, and she has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for six cycles, and she successfully repaid the loans. The past loans have helped her better support her daughter’s education and relieve her family’s financial burden. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy more grocery items for selling, and use a portion of it to spend on buying piglets and pig feeds. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep her children in school and increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for selling.

loans.name: Pency

texts.en:
Pency has managed a retail business for almost 21 years. Sometimes she cooks snacks to sell for additional income. Through her earnings from the business she is able to provide some of her children's educational needs. 

She still needs to develop her business because she wants to earn more income in order to fully support her children's needs. Because of this, Pency is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and many other items. She will do her very best to manage the business well and become more profitable.

loans.use: to buy beverages, breads, canned goods and many other items.

loans.name: Safina Group

texts.en:
Mary is in her early 40s. She is single with two children who are still at school. She has been running a grocery store for one year now. She works from 3.30 pm to 11.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Mary's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling secondhand clothes and to buy more drinks for the grocery. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy a TV set, pay school fees, cover household expenses and buy a sofa set. She will use this loan to  restock the missing items in her grocery shop. She dreams of having a big grocery store and another shop for secondhand clothes.

Mary will share this loan with her loan group Safina, which has eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in her grocery shop.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Ou Reang Ov district where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Yat, 46, is a married mother of four children, two of whom are still in school. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and cassava growing. Having been in this business for more than 20 years, Yat is able to earn about US$13 per day to support her family. 
Yat has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Now, she is applying as a second-time borrower with VisionFund to pay for her daughter's university fees. She hopes to send and keep her daughter in university and she hopes that her daughter will have a good and bright future from her academic studies and make a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Chanty

texts.en:
Chanty, aged 47 years old, is married and has four kids, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She lives with her husband in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband earn a living by farming rice. Together, they can earn about 29,000 KHR per day from their current business and manage to save about 18,000 KHR each day after offsetting expenses.

Chanty has just joined VisionFund for this cycle. She is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter in a local university specializing in midwifery. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her daughter to university, and she will also help her son to obtain a higher education and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John, a new client, is a cattle trader in Rwencence, an area of southwestern Uganda, where he has been for the last 12 years. He works hard in his business and works four days a week. He also has a bar, which is his other source of income. He opens the bar when he is not working in the cattle trade business. 

John started his cattle business in 2001 because he thought it would reward him with big profits, which he would use to uplift the status of his family. He would like to buy more cows to make more profit and better cater to his family's needs. 

John’s clients are mainly Rwandans, who buy the cattle and take them back to Rwanda. He hopes to expand the business and to use his profits to buy a big chunk of land for his family, which will benefit the family in the long run.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Takhmina

texts.en:
Takhmina is a student of the American University of Central Asia, in the department of European Studies. Below is her story. 

“Europe has a high position in the world economy, culture, and science. I have chosen to enroll in AUCA's department of European Studies because I like some habits of European people: for example, time management, choosing a profession, and planning the future. The above listed things are very important in our life; they form our life. If we know how to manage our time and plan actions, we will succeed in many aspects of our life. These rules are used in the developed countries like the USA, European countries, etc. I also like European culture. The culture of the European countries plays a big role in world history, and I want our country to have good relationships with these countries. During my studies at AUCA I would like to get internships in some of Europe's countries. Fortunately the education schedule and system does allow students to take international internships. I would like to mention that this is not the only opportunity that AUCA gives to all of its students. One of them is a Kiva loan. So, I would like to apply for it, so that I will be able to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: To pay for higher education costs.

loans.name: Eduesa

texts.en:
Eduesa is married with 1 child. She is 42 years old and lives in Lower Salug Daku, Mahayag Zamboanga Del Sur.

Eduesa runs a sari-sari store (general store) to earn a living and has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to restock her sari-sari store with canned goods, bread, soap, soft drinks, and other items.

Eduesa has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to provide a good education to her child and to expand her sari-sari store someday.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store with canned goods, bread, soap, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Rem is 53 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Takeo province and appears in this photo with her husband and daughter who is a freshly graduated high school student this year. Rem cultivates rice on two hectares of farmland and sells her produce in the local markets. With the help of her supportive husband, she is able to make a normal income of USD 6.66 per day. 

Rem is requesting a loan to help her daughter attend a university program in Phnom Penh. She will use the loan to pay the fee for a four-year course. Her daughter’s major is accounting and finance which the most popular subject for female students in Cambodia. Rem said she is a hardworking farmer who earns a living through physical labor and she doesn't want her children to follow her way of hardship. She will try her best to provide opportunities to educate each of her children after their graduation. 

Rem is very happy and thankful for her loan funded via Kiva through its partner HKL to enable poor students to pursue a higher education and contribute to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay for four-year-course fees at the university

loans.name: Starlight Group

texts.en:
Charles, who is in his late 30s, is married and has two children who are still going to school.  

He has been running a business of selling charcoal for three years now.  He works from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Charles's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to open a small shop for fruits and vegetables and to increase on charcoal stock whenever he got a new loan. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  He used the profit to pay school fees, buy a TV set and a radio, and pay household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.  He dreams of opening a cosmetics shop.

Charles will share this loan with his loan group, "Starlight," which has ten members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth Alejandrina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mujeres De Lucha se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.
En este lugar vive la señora Elizabeth, tiene 43 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, dos mayores de edad y tres de 17, 16 y 11 años los tres menores estudian en colegio. El marido es comerciante. 
Ella y su esposo se dedican al comercio, venden artículos para el hogar, ellos se  desplazan a otros lugares a vender ollas, platos, cucharas, y ropa de todo tipo, mientras ella vende por su localidad el esposo se desplaza a ciudades del oriente ecuatoriano ofreciendo sus productos ya que es en esos lugares donde tiene sus mejores clientes, ellos dejan a crédito y cobran cada quince días, llevan más de 15 años dedicados a esta actividad la cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar ollas, cucharas, planchas y ropa de todo tipo. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres de Lucha [Fighting Women]" communal bank meets every fifteen days in the Picoaza parish of Portoviejo, a place known for being very commercial, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo Fiestas, and for the joy of its people. 

Here lives Elizabeth, who is 43 and is in a common-law marriage from which she has five children.  Two of the children are older, and the three younger ones, 17, 16, and 11, are in school.  Her husband is a businessman.  

Elizabeth and her husband earn their living in business.  They sell home products, traveling around selling pots, plates, spoons, and all kinds of clothing.  While Elizabeth is selling locally, her husband travels around to cities in the eastern part of Ecuador, because that's where the best clients are.  They sell on credit and collect every fifteen days.  They've been in business for more than fifteen years and it has allowed them to get ahead.

Elizabeth will use this loan to buy pots, spoons, plates, and all manner of clothing.  She's been with the bank from the beginning and likes it because she started her business with her first loan.  Her dream is to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: to buy pots, spoons, pans, and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Miguel Ivan

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 23 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con su esposa y su pequeña hija, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Miguel no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Miguel trabaja como chofer de taxi brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y trato amable.
Miguel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de mantenimiento y reparación de su taxi, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de darle una buena educación a su hija.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 23-year-old man.  He lives in the city of Ica, which is located in the district of Parcona, with his wife and their young daughter.  He is very hardworking and enthusiastic, and he dedicates all his efforts to moving his family ahead.  Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and because of a need to work, Miguel was unable to study towards a professional career.

Through his own initiative, Miguel works as a taxi driver, offering transportation services in his city.  He works every day for roughly ten hours, and believes that everything is going well thanks to his dedication and kind demeanor.

Miguel is very grateful to the Kiva investors.  Thanks to their offered support, he will be able to cover the cost of maintaining and repairing his taxi.  This in turn allows him to continue working and strengthening himself in order to achieve his greatest dream: to provide his daughter with a good education.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Romina Marisol

texts.en:
Romina wants to become an accountant. Romina was accepted into the Universidad Juan Misael Saracho, and now with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording graduation fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but without a loan from Vittana, she fears that she will need to defer her graduation. 

Romina plans on using the loan funds to pay her graduation fee. This fee is often more expensive than the semester's tuition and is a frequent impediment for graduating students in Tarija. Romina currently works 40 hours a week and earns earns $3 a day.  With a degree in public accounting and finance, she expects to earn $15 a day.

loans.use: to pay graduation fees.

loans.name: Naome

texts.en:
Naome is a mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She is an enterprising woman who started a retail shop in 2010 and has operated it ever since. She dedicates eight hours to the business each day and works seven days per week. She also has small rooms that she rents out to earn more income to support her family. 

Naome's business is located in Ryamigungu in Kyamuhunga, and she hopes to expand the business in future. She started the business with a hope of earning money to support her children in school. Naome would like to use the requested loan to restock her shop so that she can serve her customers, who are mainly members of the Kyamuhunga community. Her main challenge is the bad debtors who never repay their debts, but she believes that she will overcome this and with her hard work she will achieve her dream in life.

loans.use: To buy stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Nav

texts.en:
Nav is 43 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children in a rural area of the Steong Meanchey district. One of her children is still in school. For 20 years, Nav has been a fruit seller and her husband is a policeman. Together, they earn 15 USD each day. Nav has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely repaid her past loans which helped her to better support her family with enough food. 

Nav is requesting a loan to cover her daughter’s university tuition fee. Her daughter will study finance and banking. Nav hopes that her daughters will learn special skills for a long term income which will support the family.

loans.use: to cover her daughter’s university tuition fee

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 48 years old and is married with four children. She lives in DCM, Mahayag Zamboanga Del Sur. Ginalyn is a farmer who grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been a farmer for 28 years and has been a member of PMPC for four years.

Ginalyn is requesting a loan to pay for farming activities such as land and seedbed preparation. In the future, she hopes to expand her farm and provide for the good education of her children.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 68 years old and married with eight children. She lives in San Jose, Mahayag Zamboanga del Sur. For the past 30 years, Rosita has been a farmer who grows rice and corn to earn a living. She has been a member of PMPC for five years.

Rosita is requesting a loan to pay for farm activities such as land and seedbed preparation. In the future, she hopes to provide a good education for her eight children and provide for their everyday financial needs.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura was born in 1961. He is a builder. Jura has been busy with this activity more than 12 years. Jura is married and has four children; three sons and one daughter. His wife has her own business. She sells women's clothes. His elder son also sells clothes in the local market. 

Jura has not higher education and that’s why he always wanted to help his children to get higher education. Now, one of his sons, Sharifjon, studies at the Tajik State University Commerce. Sharifjon is a first course student of the economic faculty. Jura is asking for a loan of 800 USD to pay for his son’s education at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for the education of his son.

loans.name: Chanthoert

texts.en:
Chanthoert is a 36-year-old mother of five children, three of whom are still in school. She lives in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. For almost ten years, Chanthoert and her husband have earned a living through farming rice and selling grocery items. Sometimes they work as paid laborers in their local area. Chanthoert and her husband earn about 31,000 KHR per day. She has been with VisionFund for two cycles and she successfully repaid her past loans which have helped to improve her livelihood. 

Chanthoert is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland. She will use a portion of her loan to buy more grocery items for resale. Chanthoert hopes to make more healthy crops and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a higher educated woman. She is smart and kind. After graduation from pedagogical university, she began working as a teacher in a school. She has great experience in teaching. She has worked in this field more than 16 years. Her husband works in a finance organization. They have three children. 

Marhabo’s daughter Madina is a student of the third course. Marhabo must pay for her daughter's education at the university. She is asking for a loan of $650 to pay for her daughter’s education. She awaits your support and she thanks in advance Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter’s education.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 27 años, está casada con Leonardo y tiene 2 hijos de 10 y 6 añitos que viven con ella en su casa hecha de material noble. Dina tiene una tienda de comestibles en su pequeña comunidad. Se inicio en esta labor hace mas de 3 años, debido a que su localidad no contaba con negocios de este tipo permitiéndole  realizar buenas ventas de los productos que considera como de primera necesidad como son el arroz, azúcar, verduras, cereales y  abarrotes en general.Entre sus principales clientes están sus vecinos que se dedican integralmente a actividades agrícolas  que visitan su negocio desde muy temprano para preparar sus alimentos y dirigirse posteriormente a sus respectivos centros de trabajo. Desde que se inició con su negocio ha ido mejorando y aumentando la mercadería que adquiriere puesto que siempre tiene el deseo de agregar más productos para surtirlo y ser la primera opción comercial entre los pobladores de su comunidad. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para seguir adelante. Desea en esta oportunidad contar con 2,000 nuevos soles y seguir invirtiendo en su negocio con la compra de mercadería al por mayor como sacos de arroz, azúcar, enlatados de leche, atún; entre otros.
texts.en:
Dina is twenty-seven years old and is married to Leonardo.  Together, they have two children (10 years old and 6 years old) who live with them in their home made of fine material. Dina has a grocery store in the small community where she lives.  She began this work more than three years ago because her town did not have this type of business; she was therefore able to make good sales on basic need food items, like rice, sugar, vegetables, grains, and other general groceries.  

Her main customers are her neighbors, who mostly make a living in agriculture.  They visit her business very early in the morning so that they are able to prepare their meal and then leave for their respective jobs.  Since she began her business, she has been improving and growing the merchandise that she offers.  She always has the desire to add more products and to grow her supply so that she is her neighbors' first choice of where to go to buy their groceries.  

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she hopes to have the necessary trust in order to continue moving forward.  With this loan, she is requesting 2,000 soles that she will use to invest in her business by busing merchandise wholesale, including sacks of rice, sugar, canned milk, tuna, and other items.

loans.use: to buy basic food products, like rice, sugar, canned items, and others.

loans.name: Heang

texts.en:
A married mother of five children from Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham, Heang is a rice farmer who owns and manages one and a half hectares of farmland. To make additional income for the household, Heang is also involved in fishing activities along the Tonle Sap River. With the full support from her husband, she is able to make an average income of KHR 40,000 per day. 

Heang is experiencing difficulties in her fishing activities because her boat is ruined and unsafe to use. She is asking for a loan in the sum of KHR 2,500,000 to buy a new boat and its motors to sustain her current business. She hopes this will help her make a stable income to secure the overall welfare of the family.

loans.use: to buy a new boat and motors to sustain her current business.

loans.name: Restituta

texts.en:
Restituta is 63 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin, Philippines. She is married and has six children.
 
To earn a living, Restituta has a business selling snacks in the local community. She earns about PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Restituta has requested a loan  to purchase additional ingredients used for snack making such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, margarine, milk, egg, flavorings, etc. 
Restituta has been a member of PMPC for eight years.  In the future, Restituta  would like to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients used for snack making such as flour, sugar, oil, butter, margarine, milk, egg, flavorings,etc.

loans.name: Saadiya

texts.en:
Saadiya is a 44-years-old Iraqi client. She is married and has a single child. Saadiya helps her husband in providing the family income.

Saadiya is a tailor. She used to work with her friend who was also a tailor and gained her experience in this field from her. In 2010, Saadiya started to work for herself and gained her own reputation in the neighborhood, thanks to her unique style in tailoring women's outfits.

Saadiya is requesting a loan of 1,800 USD. She will use this loan to buy two new sewing machines in order to increase her production. She is aiming to grow her business more and increase her profits in order to provide a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is married with with five children. Josefina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Josefina is a farmer and grows vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan to buy additional seedlings for her gardening business.

Josefina has been a member of PMPC for more than one year. In the future, Josefina hopes to expand her garden area into a bigger one with different vegetables planted.

loans.use: to buy additional seedlings for her vegetable gardening business.

loans.name: Gangaram

texts.en: Gangaram is 48 years old and has a family with 4 children. Three of them go to school. Gangaram's main source of income is rice cultivation. During the off seasons he earns some extra income trough fishing and gardening. With the support of Seva MFI he has bought a tractor for his rice cultivation. His tractor needs two new main tires for which he applied for a loan of SRD 7100.

loans.use: To pay for two main tires for his tractor.

loans.name: Chaneng

texts.en:
A married mother of three children, Chaneng is 46 years old and a resident in Kampong Cham Province, Srey Sonthor district. She is a farmer in the local area who grows rice on 1 hectare of farmland. Engaging in this business for over than 20 years, she can earn around $9 per day.

Chaneng is a client in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is now applying for a loan to pay for her son's university fee to study engineering. She hopes that her son will have a special skill for a long-term income that will support the family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university fee to study engineering.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Santhor District

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Sophorn, 28, is married with two children residing in a rural village of the Dambae district of Kampong Chang province. To support the family, she has been planting cassava for 10 years, while her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about $10 per day and can save about $4 each day for their future needs. 

Sophorn has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle. Now she is asking for another loan with VisionFund. She is going to use this loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee de 51 años,  solo pudo cursar segundo grado de educación básica, comenta que no pudo seguir estudiando por que su familia estaba en una situación difícil por la pobreza en  que vivían, teniendo que  en vez de estudiar, trabajar para ayudar a sus padres. Esta casada y su esposo se dedica a las labores agrícolas. Su única hija, ya es mayor de edad y no vive con ellos. Solo se tienen el uno al otro.


Ella trabaja en el comercio, tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado, tiene 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, se dedico a esta actividad gracias a su tía, con ella trabajo durante un tiempo. 

Anteriormente realizo otro tipo de actividades, costura y cocina, donde obtenía ingresos. 
El lugar de trabajo esta a 15 km. de su casa, lo que le hace madrugar para estar luego en el negocio. Se va a las 5 de la mañana  para estar 10 minutos a las 6 a.m. en el puesto de venta de lunes a sábado.
                                                                                                                                                                    

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para surtir el negocio(venta de ropa), aprovechar la época navideña, donde hay mas demanda de  ropa, el cual le generaría mejores ingresos para su familia.

 Haydee desea tener un puesto fijo donde vender, ya que en el actual tiene muchas variaciones y se mueve periódicamente, lo que le limita fidelizar clientes, por las rotaciones de puesto y que su negocio este bien surtido de productos.
texts.en:
Haydee is a 51-year old woman who could only attend school until second grade. Her family was in a difficult situation of poverty and she had to quit her studies and work to help her parents. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. Her only daughter, who is already an adult, does not live with them. They only have each other. 

She works in retail and has a small stand in the market, where she sells clothes. She has 15 years of experience in the business after starting out with her aunt for some time. She performed other activities before, such as cooking and sewing, with which she obtained income. She works 15 km away from her house and needs to wake up very early. She leaves at 5am in the morning so that she can be at the stand at 5.50am, from Monday to Saturday. 

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes for her business, so that she can make the most of the Christmas season. There is more demand of clothes at this time of year, which would generate more income for her family. She would also like to have a permanent stand to sell. Her current one changes and moves periodically, which makes it more difficult to have loyal clients. She also wants her business to be well stocked.

loans.use: to stock her business of clothing sales and to make the most of the Christmas season, when there is higher demand and bigger potential to generate more income for her family.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok is 45 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening up animals for more than ten years, earning one dollar per day. Two of her children are employed in a garment factory. They make an income of $6 each day to help support the family. To improve her family’s finances, Sok is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase farmland for growing rice. This purchase will help expand her business and earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn a bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase farmland for growing rice

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: From Santuk district of Kampong Thom, Phat is 37 years old and a farmer, who has been cultivating rice for more than 13 years. She learned how to farm from her parents, and it has been the major source of income for the family. Phat aims to expand her business and increase her farming productivity to provide enough for the family’s basic needs. However, she has insufficient capital to invest into the business to achieve her dream. To help her further develop her farming business, Phat has applied for a loan amounting to KHR 2,500,000 to buy a piece of land to enlarge her farming area. This purchase will allow her to generate better crop yields, and thereby increase her household income. Phat and her family rely heavily on the goodwill of the lenders and are thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to enlarge her farming area.

loans.name: Aura Lylian

texts.es: Aura Lylian mayor de edad acompañada con cuatro hijos el cual solo uno esta bajo su cargo, originaria del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicada en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, el turismo y sus deliciosas playas, Aura se dedica a la venta de servicios de transporte de triciclos que circulan por todo el municipio de Chinandega, al igual que también se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras el cual tiene un puesto en uno de los mercados del municipio, el cual ofrece deliciosas frutas y verduras como: papas, ayote, pipián, plátanos verdes y maduros, cebollas, tomates, chiltomas, papayas, repollos, guayabillas, piñas entre otros, el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra de frutas y verduras por lo que su demanda crece mas en estas fechas próximas de navidad al igual que darle mantenimiento a sus unidades de triciclos
texts.en: Aura Lylian is older and has four children, only one of whom is in her care.  She's from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, predominated by business, tourism, and its delightful beaches.  Aura earns her living with a tricycle transportation service that traverses the town of Chinandega.  She also has a stand in one of the town markets where she sells delicious fruits and vegetables like potatoes, pumpkins, squash, green and yellow bananas, onions, tomatoes, sweet peppers, papaya, cabbage, guayabilla fruit, pineapple, etc.  She plans to use this loan as working capital, to invest in fruits and vegetables because demand is increasing during the holiday season.  She'll also do some maintenance on her tricycles.

loans.use: to invest as working capital in items like fruits, and maintenance of her three-wheeled transport vehicles.

loans.name: Kabare Tusimukye Women Group

texts.en:
Jones is a member of a Kabare Tusimukye Women Group and a mother of six children who are all in school.

She is a business woman with a tailoring business that she started in 2009. The business is located in a nearby trading centre. She started it with a purpose of getting money to help earn a living. In addition to the tailoring business, she also sells coffee, which boosts her income in a given period. She works six days on the tailoring business and works 12 hours per day. Her clients are mainly schools in her vicinity since they give her tenders to make school uniforms for the students. She has high hopes that her business will expand, which will help her family to develop. Her biggest challenge is competition from other tailors in the area, but she hopes that if the loan (500,000 UGX is her share) is given, she will buy more materials and compete favorably and hence succeed.

The eighth person at the extreme right is the Ugafode credit officer.

loans.use: To buy cloth materials.

loans.name: Nang

texts.en:
Nang, 50, is married with six children residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, Cambodia. She has six children, four of whom are dependents. For the last four years, she has been growing cassava and distilling alcohol, while her husband is a paid worker. They are able to earn about 76,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Nang is a sixth-loan client with VisionFund. The past loans from VisionFund have helped her better support her family. Now she is seeking another loan with VisionFund of 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable to her make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en:
Zaynura is a married parent with two children. She is a hardworking woman who works in a state organization. Zaynura is a well-bred person and her husband is an entrepreneur. Her son Abdullo graduated school this year and successfully entered Tomsk State University where he is studying law. Zaynura’s son lives in a university cottage. He likes Russia but is planning to return to Tajikistan to work when he graduates. 

Zaynura is requesting a 3,100 USD loan pay for her son’s education. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
Edith tiene 24 años, está casada con Máximo quien es padre de sus pequeña Xiomara de 5 añitos. 
Vive junto a su familia en su casa propia hecha de madera. Su actividad principal es la agricultura y producción de los productos mas rentables de su zona como son el cacao orgánico, palillo; entre otros.
Se inició en esta labor junto a su pareja ya que fue una labor que aprendió desde muy niña creciendo junto a sus padres en la abnegada y sacrificada labor agrícola.Cuando se independizó de sus padres no contaba con un terreno propio y fue gracias a sus ahorros que logró acumular el dinero suficiente para comprarse su propio terreno agrícola. Para el normal desempeño de sus labores debe contar con abono orgánico y herramientas en buen estado para realizar las actividades de mantenimiento como es el retiro de maleza, corte de tallos de entre sus plantaciones de cacao; entre otros indispensables para la obtención de cosechas con un buen valor comercial.Al finalizar la compaña productiva realiza la cosecha de sus productos y vente posteriormente sus productos a los compradores del lugar donde logra recuperar el dinero que suele invertir. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En su primera oportunidad desea contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para la compra de abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Edith is 24 years old and is married to Máximo, who is the father of her young 5-year-old daughter, Xiomara.  They live together in their own home made of wood.  Her main work is in agriculture and in growing products that are the most profitable in her area, including organic cocoa, a plant similar to the guava-tree, and others.

She began this work together with her husband, but it was a type of labor that she learned when she was very young, growing up together with her parents in the agricultural sector.  When she became independent from her parents, she did not have her own land.  Thanks to her savings, she was able to pull together enough money to buy her own plot. For her regular tasks and work, she has organic fertilizer and tools that are in good shape; she uses them for weeding, cutting the stems on her cocoa plantations, and for other tasks that are necessary for a good commercial-quality harvest.  When her products are ready, she harvests and later sells them to buyers; this allows her to recover the money that she had previously invested.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives in order to move herself ahead.  She promises to pay her installments on time.  With this loan, she is requesting 1,000 soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Rem is a 25-year-old mother of one son. She is a rice farmer. Her husband helps to supplement the family income by working as a paid worker. Together, they can earn about 28,000 Cambodian riel (KHR) per day from the current business and can manage to save about 14,000 KHR each day.

Rem’s group consists of two other female members, who have just been with VisionFund for this cycle. Rem is now leading her group to ask for a loan. As the group's leader, Rem will use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase the family’s income and make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is an old client in the institution. He provides for his family using money from selling milk and fattening cattle.

Silver is requesting a 2,000,000 UGX loan to buy more cows and expand his business to increase milk production and sales. He thanks UGAFODE microfinance Limited (MDI) for the assistance which has enabled him to sustain his business and family in the long run. He encourages the institution to continue supporting low-income earners like himself.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Gustine

texts.en:
Gustine is 55 years old married with seven children. Two of his children still attend school. Gustine works as a coffee trader, a business he started in 2009 to supplement his income. He had started constructing a permanent house with savings from his coffee business. Gustine found out that he could not finish his house.

Gustine is requesting a loan to buy building materials to complete his house. He hopes to complete it without affecting his business.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao is 29 years old and married with two dependent children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district earning a living through farming rice, growing cassava and grocery selling. She has been in these businesses for nine years. 

This is Mao’s fourth loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She successfully used the loans to better her living conditions. Now, she is applying for a loan to buy a plot of farmland. She hopes to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of farmland

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta, 52, lives in the Philippines in Barangay Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occide. She is married and has two children. 

Marietta has a shop that sells soft drinks. She has been a member of the Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for five years and has applied for a loan to purchase cases of soft drink to sell.

In the future, she hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase cases of soft drink to sell

location.town: Ozamis-P2 Sangay Diot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Mohry

texts.en:
Mohry is 42 years old and widowed with three children. She is a nurse. Mohry works hard every day to earn enough salary to feed her children as she is the sole breadwinner. Mohry’s elder daughter studies at the university and her little two children are schoolboys. Mohry plans to go to China with her children for the autumn holidays but she does not have enough money to buy air tickets.

Mohry is requesting a 5,000 TJS loan to buy airplane tickets to China. Mohry and her orphan children wait your support.

loans.use: to buy airplane tickets to China

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motor bike.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en: Mwaka, age 25, is a married woman who has been blessed with three children. She owns a house which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years she has operated a retail shop selling household consumables such as wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She says seasonality is her major challenge in the business. Mwaka is requesting a loan of Kshs 40,000 to boost her shop by purchasing bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking  oil. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Meet Doris, a 21-year-old farmer who lives in Nyamira. She has been farming for eight years and specializes in dairy and tea farming. She also plants onions and other vegetables, bananas and sugarcane, which do very well in her area.

She gets her income from the sale of milk and tea. She also has a small business in the area. She loves farming in general, but the challenges she encounters are getting the right market and having enough capital.

Doris chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because the organization focuses on improving the livelihood of small-scale farmers.This loan will enable her to purchase irrigation equipment, which will make her crops do well due to a continuous supply of water. Thus, Doris will increase her income and improve her family's livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Jeliah

texts.en:
Jeliah is a farmer who lives in Nyamira. For the past 10 years, she has been a farmer who rears rabbits and has dairy cows. Jeliah also grows tea to sell in the local market. She enjoys rearing rabbits and then selling them but her business challenge is that the market is not easily accessible. Jeliah chose Juhudi Kilimo because they offer low interest rates on their loans. During her training, which is offered by the business development officers, she was advised that her loan should only be used for the assigned project.

Jeliah is requesting a loan to purchase rabbits.

loans.use: to purchase rabbits

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif is 41 years old and married. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 17 years. He is very hard-working and passionate about his work. He enjoys growing potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and planting fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family. Asif’s income from his business is 80 AZN per month. In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He is requesting a loan of 1,000 AZN to buy new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him grow more vegetables and fruits in order to keep revenue coming in during the winter, which will help him cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Shoista

texts.en:
Shoista is 25 years old. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to be successful in life. She is divorced and is bringing up her child alone. 

Shoista sews national dresses. She has been busy with this activity more than 4 years. Little by little with passing of the time, she perfected her knowledge. She actually is a good sewer and that’s why she has her own clients. Currently, she manages her business alone. Now she needs money to improve her living condition. She is going to increase working capital and maximize profit. 

This is her fourth loan with IMON. Shoista is asking for a loan in the amount of 7,200 Somoni to buy fabrics, threads, etc. She is grateful in advance for financial support in helping her to realize her plans. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fabrics, threads, etc. for increasing working capital

loans.name: Efrain

texts.es:
Efraín tiene 31 años, es soltero y sin hijos.Vive en su casa propia hecha de madera que construyó desde muy joven. Se dedica a la agricultura hace más de 10 años y es su principal sustento económico.
Aprendió este oficio desde muy niño por sus padres porque creció en el campo y al igual que sus hermanos se convirtió en su única actividad económica. Posee una parcela de 2 hectáreas que compró desde joven con el apoyo considerable de sus padres y en donde posee actualmente plantaciones de cacao orgánico, achiote, barbasco; entre  otros. Para un adecuado trabajo y para obtener buenos resultados debe de contar con dinero suficiente que le permita adquirir abono prgánico, herramientas y contratar a trabajadores del lugar para tareas complicadas y colectivas. Al finalizar la temporada cosecha sus productos y los lleva hasta los centros de acopio donde logra recuperar el dinero que invirtió. Este es su primer préstamco con Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para seguir adelante. En está oportunidad desea contar con 500 nuevos soles comprar abono orgánico para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Efraín is 31, single, and doesn't have children.  He lives in his own house that he constructed out of wood when he was very young.  He has made his living in agriculture for more than ten years and it's his main source of financial support.  He learned his trade from his parents when he was very small; he was raised in the country, and as with his siblings, agriculture became his only business.  Efraín has a two-hectare parcel that he bought when he was young with considerable help from his parents.  He currently has plantings of organic cocoa beans, achiote, barbasco, and other crops.  

In order to do a sufficient job and get good results, Efraín needs enough money to buy organic fertilizer and tools, and to hire local workers to do difficult and multi-person jobs.  At the end of the season, he'll harvest his crops and take them to the local storehouses where he'll recoup his investment.  This is Efraín's first Kiva loan and he hopes you'll put the trust in him he needs to move ahead.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en: Ziya is 41 years of age and married. He has 2 sons. Ziya is a very positive man. He is a market vendor. He has 12 years experience in this business. Ziya sells different kinds of goods like tea, flour, beverages, macaroni, butter and candies. His business allows him to make his living and cover his living expenses. Ziya is a man with a very good reputation in his area. He is requesting his seventh loan. He will use his loan funds to enhance his business merchandise with special-offer products, and to diversify his products in order to satisfy the requirements of his customers, thus increasing his income. He is investing much hope in this current loan, and is hopeful that it will fulfill his customers' needs.

loans.use: to enhance his business merchandise with special-offer products

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en:
Chizi is a married woman with 7 children, all of whom still attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Chizi has operated a poultry business for the past 2 years, selling from home to neighbors and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of diseases which attack her chicks in this business. 

With the loan Chizi is requesting, she wants to purchase chicken feed and also medicine for her chicks. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed and also medicine for her chicks.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona is 52 and is married with four children.  She is managing her vegetable garden as an aid to her husband's income from employment.

Chona works growing basic grains (corn and beans). She’s been in this activity for 3 years, having learned from her parents, who were always interested in learning. She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase fertilizer for her garden.  She decided to go into the same line of work because when she married, she had no other option but to grow basic grains in order to obtain food for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her garden

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 31 years of age and is a married person. Elnur is a merchant and is selling car parts. His business is located close to a car maintenance shop. This gives him an opportunity to have many repeat customers and a stable business. Elnur has been in this business for 3 years. During this time, he has developed a good business network that supplies him with the parts his customers order.

Elnur would like to borrow 700 AZN to purchase spare parts in bulk. He dreams that one day he will be able to build one more shop.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur is 43 years of age, married with three children. Seven  years ago, he decided to open a business so that he could better support his family, which is comprised of his wife and their three children, ages 3, 9 and 11. He works together with his two assistants in a small cafeteria, which he built through hard work and sacrifice. His business is well known due to its strategic location and good service.

Seymur 's biggest dream is to expand his business so that he can serve more customers. Therefore, he has applied for a loan 2000 AZN  to remodel and buy inventory. He hopes to send his children to college.

loans.use: to remodel and buy inventory.

loans.name: Chana

texts.en:
Chana is a hardworking woman and a mother of a small child, living with her family in Preah Sdach district, Prey Veng province. Like the other villagers, Chana is in an agricultural culture, primarily growing rice to sell. The income generated from farming is barely enough to satisfy their daily needs, so Chana also runs a small tailoring shop in the village to earn additional income. 

Currently, Chana’s family doesn't have a safe latrine for use at home, so she wants to improve their sanitation and personal hygiene. In this particular way, she has requested a loan of 1,300 US dollars to build a household latrine. Thanks to the water loan program offered by HKL and Kiva with a special interest rate, she is encouraged to focus on healthy living conditions, safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve sanitation for the household.

loans.name: Tehmine

texts.en:
Tehmine has been engaged in production at an in-home bakery for about 5 years. She has been baking bread and different cookies and sells it at local markets. Tehmine lives with her two daughters and does her best to sustain their living.

In addition to her small bakery business, Tehmine is also working in the local bakery. She receives a salary which is barely enough for covering the family's basic costs. Realizing that the income from the in-home bakery business is very important for her, Tehmine wants to increase it. She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase raw materials and tools needed for her work.

She has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. This loan is very important for Tehime to be able to enlarge her business and ensure a better life for her school age daughter. Tehmine waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for raw materials and tools for bakery business

loans.name: Mardea

texts.en: Mardea is 29 year old and lives in Congo Town, She is unmarried and her fiancée is a contractor; they have two children ages 6 and 13, who are presently in school and live at home. She has been operating a shop where she sells used clothes for the past three years; she is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business.  She plans to build a house and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Umuse Group

texts.fr:
J. Marie fait partie du groupe Umuse   et  habite à Bubanza. Il a 26 ans et est marié à  Estella,  un commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 3 enfants âgés de 3mois à 4 ans.

Il  fait le commerce de brochettes depuis  10 ans. 

C’est son premier crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter 2 chèvres pour vendre beaucoup de la brochette   , pour gagner plus. 

Dans prochaines années, il voudrait faire le commerce de boutique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Marie is part of the group Umuse and lives in Bubanza. He is 26 years old and married to Estella, a merchant. Together they have three children, from 3 months old to 4 years old. 

J. Marie has been selling kebabs for ten years. 

This is his first Turame loan. With the KIVA loan he is obtaining, he is going to increase his capital and purchase two goats in order to sell a lot of kebabs, so as to earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to have a shop and see his children educated.

loans.use: to purchase goats to sell a lot of kebobs, so as to earn more

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun is 39 years old, married, and has four children. She resides in the Phnom Srouch District of Kampong Speu Province.  She makes a living through farming rice and raising cows and pigs, which she has been doing for 20 years.  Her husband is a paid worker. 
 
Oun is requesting a loan from VIsionFund, which she will use to pay for her daughter’s university at the Faculty of Finance and Banking. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her daughter in university to pursue her degree so she can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s university

location.town: Kompong Speu province, Phnom Srouch district

loans.name: Sidlawende Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA représente le groupe SIDLAWENDE II. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 02 vont à l’école.
Elle vend du bois de chauffe, du charbon de bois depuis 06ans. Mme s’approvisionne dans les provinces avec les camions. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Mme veut s’acheter 02 rangées de bois et 03sacs de charbons de bois.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en: Ms. LAMOUSSA represents the group SIDLAWENDE II. She is a married mother of four children. The oldest is 14 years old, and the youngest is 4. Two go to school. Ms. LAMOUSSA has been selling firewood and charcoal for six years. She gets her supplies from the provinces by truck. Her customers include both men and women. She wants to purchase 2 rows of firewood and 3 sacks of charcoal. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to expand her business and provide education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase firewood and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 58 years old. He is married and resides with three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. The couple has been selling clay piggy banks for more than ten years, making an income of $6 daily. One of his children is a garment worker who earns about $2 per day.

To improve his family’s finance, Sok is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase an arc welding machine for his son. This purchase will help his son obtain the ability to run a metal shop (to produce windows, doors and roofing) and generate additional income to financially support the family.

In the future, he would like to take another loan from Kredit to expand the business and help his youngest child earn a bachelor’s degree. Moreover, he plans to build a new house when he has enough money.

loans.use: to purchase an arc welding machine for his son

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Here is 45-year-old Hawa from Liberia. She lives and works in the Congo Town area, She’s married and her husband is a driver. They have four children between the ages of 18 and 23.  Only three are presently in school and live at home, while her oldest child is working and living on his/her own. 

For over five years, Hawa has been operating a table business  in the local market where she sells charcoal and red oil.  She requested a loan to purchase more charcoal and red oil to resell.  Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal and red oil (palm oil) to resell.

loans.name: Kenedy Stephen

texts.en:
Kenedy is 22 years old and still single. He has been selling clothes, veils, and earrings for three years. His business is not prone to competition as there are not many such dealers.

He stocks rear clothes and veils that are specific to responsible women.

He has repaid one loan with Finance (SS) Limited, and done so on time.

He wants to buy expensive earrings, necklaces, toys, and clothes.

loans.use: To pay for earrings, necklaces, clothes, and toys

loans.name: Horng

texts.en:
Horng, 45, is married with three children. She and her husband live in Cambodia, in a village in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice and working as paid workers for 27 years. They earn about 38,000 Cambodian riel per day.
 
Horng is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. She is now applying for an education loan to pay for her son to study at university, in the faculty of nursing.

She hopes this loan will enable her son to have a good educational background so as to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her son to study at university

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 32, is a married father of three children, two girls and one boy ages 2 to 8 years old. He is working as a construction worker and his wife  works as a cleaner in a restaurant, earning a low salary. They all live in a Roma community in very poor conditions. 

Ali's house needs immediate renovations. Every winter it costs a lot of money to buy coal to keep the house warm. Ali is applying for a loan to buy materials to renovate his home’s roof which has been needing repairs for a long time. The damage to the roof is so great that when it is snowing and raining, the water leaks into the home causing additional damage, drafts and poor living conditions.

Ali would like to get the roof repaired quickly so that he can keep everyone in the family warm, safe and healthy. Ali hopes in the future to find a better paid job and offer better living conditions for his family. He  is very thankful for all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy materials to renovate his home’s roof which has been needing repairs for a long time

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is Hawa from Liberia. She is 41 years old and lives in the Congo Town area along with her husband and four children; her children are between the ages of 9 and 19 and they all attend school. Her husband is a driver. 

She has been operating a shop for the last five years; she cooks and sells rice and soup. She mentioned this business is the major sources of income for her home. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more food ingredients such as fish, meat, oil, pepper, Vita, etc. for her business. 

Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients such as fish, meat, oil, pepper, Vita, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Kaimah

texts.en:
Kaimah is 45 year old, married, and has four children who attend school.  She lives in Congo Town.  Her husband is a driver.  She did not attend school but she manages her business well. She sells oil, rice, peppers, onions, etc., which she has been doing for six years. 

Kaimah is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more oil, rice, peppers, onions, etc. for her business. In the future, she would like to build a house for children.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, peppers, onions, etc. for her business

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
Gloria María es una joven muy trabajadora y emprendedora de 27 años de edad, la cual es soltera y de ella no depende ninguna otra persona. Ella tiene un grado de educación secundaria completa la cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo moral y financiero de sus padres a pesar de las limitaciones y carencias que ellos tenían graduándose como bachiller en ciencias y letras. Gloria María ve diariamente la escasez de empleo impidiendo que ella trabaje en una empresa privada o pública por lo que decidió dedicarse al comercio y ha iniciado un pequeño negocio de venta de comida el cual la apoya su madre. El punto de su negocio es estratégico ya que es muy transitado por transportistas de buses, camiones, volquetas, etc. y en la zona no hay ningún tipo de negocio que ofrezca lo que ella hace. Ella ha identificado que los niveles más altos de venta que tiene son los fines de semana pero carece de equipo y herramientas para atender a sus clientes y mejorar su establecimiento.
Por lo que hoy en día ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar financiamiento para la compra de utensilios de cocina, materia prima, mandar a elaborar un rotulo para que su pequeño negocio sea más visible, mesas, sillas para que sus clientes puedan sentarse.
Ella sueña con que su pequeño local deje de ser pequeño y tenga las condiciones adecuadas para que su clientela pueda sentirse cómodas logrando obtener mejores ingresos, mejorar la atención y brindando mejores servicios de los que actualmente ofrece. Con las ganancias ella planea hacer un área recreativa para los niños y las familias innovando en su negocio y haciendo un gran éxito de él.
texts.en:
Gloria Maria is a young very hard-working entrepreneur, 27 years of age, who is single and responsible for no children. She finished secondary education, thanks to the moral and financial help of her parents, despite their limitations and lack of resources. She graduated with a diploma in science and letters.

Daily, Gloria Maria witnessed the shortage of jobs, impeding her from working in a private or public enterprise, and she decided to dedicate herself to commerce. She began a small business with her mother's help selling meals. The location of her business is strategic, a route much traveled by buses, trucks, dump trucks, etc. In the zone there is no business similar to hers offering what she offers. 

Gloria has noted that the largest sales come on weekends but she lacks the equipment and tools to attend to her customers and improve her establishment. For that reason, Gloria sees that she needs to request financing to purchase kitchen utensils, primary materials, to have a sign made so that her small business will be more visible, and to buy tables, and chairs so that her customers may be seated.

Gloria's dream is that some day, her small business will cease to be small and she can have adequate conditions for her customers to be more comfortable, helping her obtain better income and improve services over those currently offered. 

With her improved earnings, she plans to create a recreation area for children and families, innovating her business and making a grand success of it.

loans.use: buy kitchen utensils and equipment to attend to customers.

loans.name: Bissighin Wendwaoga Group

texts.fr:
Mr SALFO est responsable du groupe BISSIGHIN WENDWAOGA. Marié, il est père d’un enfant. L’enfant est âgé de 02ans. Il a 06personnes en charge.
Mr est couturier depuis 10ans. Il s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont les hommes et les femmes.
Il veut s’acheter une machine à coudre, 03rouleaux de popeline, des fermetures éclaires et des fils.
Mr veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Il ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle et étendre les limites de son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. SALFO is the official of the group BISSIGHIN WENDWAOGA. He is a married father of a child, who is 2 years old, and he has six persons to support. 

Mr. SALFO has been a clothier for ten years. He gets his supplies at the market in his district. His customers include both men and women. He wants to purchase a sewing machine, 3 rolls of poplin, some zippers, and thread. He wants to reinvest in his business. His ambition is to purchase a parcel of land and to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, fabrics, thread, etc.

loans.name: Enedina

texts.es:
Enedina tiene 34 años, está casada con Fabier y tiene 4 hijos que son su principal motivo de vida. 
Posee una vivienda hecha de madera donde vive junto a su familia. Se inició hace mas de 15 años como agricultora junto a su esposo en un terreno de una hectárea que le heredaron sus padres. Enedina cultiva los productos más rentables de su región como el cacao orgánico; cafe orgánico, entre otros. Desde que se inició ha tratado de llevar una producción orgánica ya que recibe capacitación por parte de una entidad estatal acerca de los cuidados e instrucciones para una producción tecnificada en beneficio de una buena agricultura.
Para lograr obtener una cosecha de calidad trata siempre de mantener sus terrenos libres de malezas que crece constantemente y quita con el apoyo de trabajadores del lugar. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En está oportunidade desea contar con 3,000 nuevos soles para seguir invirtiendo en sus parcelas con la compra de abono orgánico y sacos ecológicos para guardar sus productos agrícolas.
texts.en:
Enedina is 34 years old, is married and has four children who are the principal motivation of her life. She has a house made out of wood in which she lives with her family. She started working as  a farmer alongside her husband more than 15 years ago on a one hectare lot that she inherited from her parents. 

Enedina grows the most profitable products in the region like organic cocoa and organic coffee etc. Since she has been growing organic product she has had some training from a state institution abut care and technical production that is beneficial for good agriculture. In order to obtain a quality harvest she always tries to keep her fields clear of the weeds that constantly grow. She gets help from local workers for this. 

This is Enedina's first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support that she is receiving to get ahead. She promises to pay her installments on time. At this time she needs 3,000 PEN to continue investing in her plots buying organic fertilizer and ecological bags to protect her agricultural products.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and ecological bags.

loans.name: Tahiratou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village et ont  comme activité le petit commerce.

Celle qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 35 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Elle pratique le commerce de céréales depuis sa tendre jeunesse.Ce qui fait qu'elle dispose d'une bonne expérience pour ce type de commerce.

Avec ce financement,elle compte acheter 05 sacs d'arachide ,05 sacs de mais et 05 sacs de mil.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de ses enfants,leur frais de santé et leur nourriture.
texts.en:
This group was created in July 2011. It is composed of members who live in the same village and who have small-scale businesses. The one at the far right with her arm raised in the photo is the group's official. She is 35 years old, married, and the mother of five. She has been doing commerce in grains from an early age, such that she has good experience in this type of commerce. 

With this financing, she intends to purchase 5 sacks of peanuts, 5 sacks of corn, and 5 sacks of millet. Her goal is to ensure her children's schooling, healthcare, and food needs.

loans.use: to purchase millet and corn

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the construction of a dairy shed (zero-grazing unit) for her cows.

loans.name: Musu

texts.en:
Musu is widowed and has three adult children.  She lives in Congo Town.  She did not attend school so decided to engage in a business to earn money for herself.  She operates a shop selling lappa (an African cloth mostly used by women), which she has been doing for six years. She learned selling from her mother.  She works seven hours a day and uses the bus to get her supplies to her shop.  

Musu is requesting a loan, which will use use to purchase more lappa for her business.  She is proud that her business has made her independent   Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lappa (an African cloth mostly used by women)

loans.name: Javier Alberto

texts.es:
Javier es un hombre de 25 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Javier pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas.
Por iniciativa propia, Javier trabaja como programador en una empresa de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y buen desempeño.
Javier se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará un programa informático especial que necesita para realizar sus labores, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Javier is a 25-year old man.  He is single and lives in Chincha with his parents and siblings.  Javier is very hard-working and enthusiastic.  He has a great desire to get ahead.  Thanks to his hard work and his parents' support, Javier was able to study to Systems Engineering. 
On his own initiative, Javier got a job as a programmer for a business in his city.  He works every day for approximately ten hours.  He believes that it is going well for him because of his dedication and how well he performs his work. 
Javier is very grateful for the Kiva lenders; thanks to the help they have offered, he will purchase a special computer program that he needs to do his work.  He will continue working and putting forth effort to make his greatest dream come true- to have his own house.

loans.use: to purchase a computer program.

loans.name: La Union Hace La Fuerza Group

texts.es: El grupo “LA UNION HACE LA FUERZA” está conformada por socios y socias honestos y trabajadores quienes se encuentran muy contentos por encontrarse pasando 07 ciclo. Iván tiene 44 años es conviviente con 02 hijo educando en el colegio. Hace 20 años brinda servicios de taxista. Años atrás trabajaba para una entidad pública brindando servicios de mantenimiento de vehículos. El préstamo los invertirá en el mantenimiento de su auto.
