texts.es: El G.S Dios es Amor, está conformado por tres integrantes entre ellos, Santos Francisca de 47 años de edad, soltera y del domicilio del departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, quien es propietaria de una panadería ubicada en  una comarca aledaña a su domicilio, también cuenta con un molino con el que vende sus servicios a la comunidad, y una pequeña pulpería, con la que obtiene más ingresos ella realiza sus compras al contado; inicio sus negocios con capital propio para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos; Julia de 46 años, soltera y del mismo domicilio, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general así como también a la venta de celulares, accesorios, prendas de platas, laminado y acero, ella realiza sus compras al contado, sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante en otros lugares, al contado y al crédito el cual lo recupera semanal, quincenal y mensualmente, una de sus metas y sueños es poder hacer que crezca su negocio y poder incrementar sus ingresos; Dany de 29 años de edad y del mismo domicilio es propietario de una panadería ubicada cerca de su domicilio el realiza sus compras de materia prima al contado y sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante, en comarcas aledañas, al contado, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar las herramientas de su panadería para tener mejorar la producción y tener más ingresos, el G.S Dios es Amor, solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo el cual servirá para mejoras en los negocios y de esa forma tener una estabilidad económica en sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Dios es Amor” (God is Love) communal bank consists of three members.  Santos Francisca, 47, is single living in Chinandega Department in the west of the country.  She owns a bakery in a district adjacent to her address and she also owns a mill whose services she sells to her community.  She also has a small grocery store that produces extra income.  She pays cash for all her purchases.  She started her businesses with her own capital in order to support her children.

Julia, 46, is single and is from the same place.  She sells general merchandise and also sells mobile phones, accessories, silver, laminated and steel jewelry.  She pays cash for her purchases and sells from place to place in other places for cash and on credit collecting weekly, biweekly and monthly.  One of her goals and objectives is to be able to make the business grow to increase her income.

Dany, 29, is also from the same place.  He owns a bakery located near his home and pays cash for his raw materials. His sales are cash-based and are from place to place in adjacent districts.  One of his dreams is to improve his bakery’s tools to improve production and earn higher income.

The God is Love group is requesting the loan to buy working capital that will be used to improve the businesses and provide economic stability for their families this way.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Flor Dely

texts.es:
La Sra. Flor dely de 32 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Originario de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su pequeño hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y  se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Por lo cual lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a su pequeno  hijo.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la venta de artesanía como alcancillas, floreros de barro, casa de barro, adornos de cocinas, jarrones. Ella dedica a su actividad unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos a clientes fijos y eventuales de forma ambulante. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio la compra y   venta de artesanía variada para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Flor agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Flor Dely is 32 years old, single, and has one underage child. She is originally from Malpaisillo, which is located in the western part of the country. She is known to be a hard-working and responsible person who very much wants to improve. In her spare time she likes to enjoy the company of her little child. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, she wasn't able to study and had to work from an early age. That is why she struggles every day in order to give her child a better future.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to make progress she runs a business selling handicrafts such as piggy banks, vases, clay houses, kitchen ornaments, and urns. She spends 10 hours a day on her business, offering her products to regular and occasional customers as a street vendor. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her business. She wants to continue buying and selling various handicrafts so that in a not-so-distant future she will have a better income. Flor is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the help they offer people with scarce economic resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock her business with clay handicrafts

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es:
José Leonel de 47 años de edad, casado, padre responsables con 2 dos hijos menores de edad. Es originario de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  José Leonel se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, ropa interior, camisolas de niños, licras, pantimedias, toallas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.   José Leonel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
José Leonel, 47, is married and a responsible father of two minor children.  He’s from León, a place located in the country’s western zone.  José Leonel is noted for being hardworking, responsible with a wish for self-improvement.  Sadly, for lack of economic resources he was unable to study a career and had to start working at a young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to his effort and his desire to get ahead, his economic activity is selling new clothes like pants, shirts, underwear, children’s camisoles, Lycra, pantyhose and towels.  He spends about 10 hours at work daily selling his goods.  

The loan’s objective is to invest in working capital to stock the store with merchandise to sell so that in the not too distant future his earnings will increase.

José Leonel thanks Kiva lenders for the support they provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have ways of earning a living with dignity.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Jose Otilio

texts.es: Jose Otilio mayor de edad soltero con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del pais, es propietario de una carpinteria donde elabora diferentes estilos y tipos de muebles como: roperos, camas, sillas, comedores, puertas y ventanas para viviendas, chineros entre otros. Jose inicia su negocio con capital propio con ahorros que el tenia, con el cual compra sus primeras herramientas de trabajo y materia prima , este negocio lo aprende gracias a su papa ya que el era carpintero,el objetivo de este credito es para invertir en su negocio, en la compra de:  madera, clavos, tornillos, pega, lacas, pliegos de lijas, y algunas herramientas y asi se incrementara mi materia prima debido a que en este tiempo los clientes buscan este producto el cual al tener más materia prima en  existencia podra elaborar diferentes tipos de muebles, no solo los encargados sino que puedo tener productos terminados, y asi el cliente tiene más opción de escoger por lo tanto sus ganancias van a incrementar.
texts.en: Jose Otilio is a single adult with five adult sons. He is a native of one of the towns of Chinandega, located in the west of the country. He is the owner of a carpentry shop where he makes different styles and types of furniture such as: armoires, beds, chairs, dining room sets, doors and windows for homes, and cupboards, among other things. Jose began his business with his own resources from savings he had, with which he bought his first tools and raw materials. He learned this business thanks to his father since he was a carpenter. The purpose of this loan is to invest in his business with the purchase of: wood, nails, screws, glue, lacquers, sheets of sandpaper, and some tools. That way he can increase his materials since, at this time, the customers look for the product. By having more materials in stock he can create different types of furniture, not just the orders, but he can have finished products and the customer has more options to choose from, and so his profits will increase.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as: wood, nails, glue, sheets of sandpaper, and lacquers, among others.

loans.name: Jesika

texts.en: Jesika is a 28-year-old farmer living in Bundibugyo ,Uganda who also trades agricultural produce. She has four children and the responsibility of taking care of them solely rests on her. As a good mother, she desires to educate her children up to the university level and set up other income-generating activities to secure their future. Price fluctuation and unpredictable weather affect her net returns. Her business goal is to become the leading agricultural produce dealer in the district. Jesika intends to use the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Zephanas

texts.en: Zephanas is a 30-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. Two years ago he decided to venture into clothes selling in order to provide basics for his family. He also is a farmer. As a good father, he desires to educate his children up to the university level and also build a permanent house to replace a mud-constructed dwelling. Seasonality is the nature of the business and inadequate capital affects his projected profits. He desires to own a modern boutique. Zephanas is requesting for a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Passy

texts.en: Passy is a 41-year-old single mother of two children living in Kasese, Uganda. Seventeen years ago, she decided to venture into clothes selling in order to raise money to pay school fees for her children. With the proceeds she has been able to educate her children in good schools and build a house for her residence. Ever changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect her profits. Her desire is to own a modern boutique that keeps up with the trends. Passy intends to use the loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel, está planificando su próxima siembra de maíz y jícama, para ello necesita invertir en insumos necesarios para que su producción sea un éxito, comprara abono, insecticidas, plaguicidas, con el crédito anterior el compro todo lo necesario para sembrar los resultados fueron muy positivos obtuvo mejores ganancias, su productos fueron de mayor calidad y ha podido cancelar lo que adeudaba.
Sigue bridando a sus hijos el apoyo incondicional en sus estudios y dándoles una buena alimentación y salud.
texts.en:
Noel is planning his next planting of corn and jícama. To do so, he needs to invest in the necessary supplies so that he will have a successful harvest. He will buy fertilizer, insecticide and pesticide. With his previous loan he bought all the supplies he needed and the results were very positive. He earned higher profits and his crops were of better quality and he was able to pay off his debts.

He continues providing his children unconditional support in their studies and insuring that they have good food and health.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Jaminton Wilson

texts.es:
Jaminton es un hombre muy trabajador, vive en la ciudad de Guadalupe y para poder salir adelante trabaja en su pequeño negocio de compra y venta de animales como vacas, ovejas, ceros, entre otros, con este pequeño negocio puede tener ingresos para sacar adelante a su familia y poder salir adelante.

Jaminton está agradecido por el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar más animales para su negocio y poder  de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos y seguir luchando para hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Salir de la pobreza y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida”.
texts.en:
Jaminton is a very hardworking man. He lives in the city of Guadalupe and to be able to get ahead he works in his small business purchasing and selling animals such as cows, sheep, and pigs, among others. With this small business he can have an income to bring his family out ahead and to be able to get ahead.

Jaminton is thankful for the support that the Kiva lenders provide him since thanks to the help that they have provided he will be able to purchase more animals for his business. In this way he will be able to improve his income and continue fighting to make his greatest dream a reality: “To overcome his poverty and give his family a better quality of life.”

loans.use: to purchase animals such as cows and pigs, among others.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, se está preparando para cultivar maíz y jícama y necesita capital para comprar insumos agrícolas (pesticidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas, abonos), con lo que tendrá la ayuda necesaria para preparar la tierra y sembrar la tierra. Con el crédito anterior ella consiguió una mejor producción, sus ventas aumentaron y los ingresos le fueron de mucha ayuda para solventar deudas y apoyar más a su familia.
Sueña con ampliar su negocio, poder cancelar las deudas y trabajar con su dinero propio.
texts.en:
María is preparing to plant corn and jicama. She needs to purchase agricultural supplies (pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, and fertilizers). With these supplies, she will have what she needs to prepare and plant the soil. 

With the previous loan, María achieved a greater yield, her sales increased, and the earnings were very helpful in paying off debts and supporting her family more. She dreams of expanding her business, being able to settle her debt, and having working capital.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies (pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, and fertilizers).

loans.name: Duo Adonai Group

texts.es: Dúo Adonai. Es conformado por la señora Hilda Carolina de 30 años de edad, y madre de Hilary su pequeña de 7 años de edad, doña Hilda se dedica a la elaboración de blusas para dama en un diseño moderno y reciente, el cual es muy vendible, por lo que solicita el capital para la compra de telas en varios colores como también conos y aplicaciones para elaborar las mismas esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar ya que el sueño de ella es tener un negocio mas grande y asi porder darle lo mejor a su hija.
texts.en:
Duo Adonai is made up of Hilda Carolina who is 30 years old and has a 7-year-old daughter Hilary. 

Hilda earns a living making ladies' blouses of a modern and fashionable design, which sell well. For this reason she is asking for capital to buy different coloured fabrics as well as cones [of thread] and trimmings for making the garments.

She hopes that Kiva can help her achieve her dream of having a larger business so she can provide the best for her daughter.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing garments.

loans.name: Dúo Santa Fe Ocaña Group

texts.es: Dúo Santa fe Ocaña, El señor Ricardo se dedica a la siembra y venta de rosas de primera, segunda y tercera calidad desde hace 9 años, la fechas de un nuvo corte de rosas se aproxima y el debe prepararse para la compra de bolsitas y compra de injertos y así nuevamente sembrar para una próxima cosecha.  El capital que tiene no le es suficiente y se ven en la necesidad de un nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir esta necesidad que tiene, también debe comprar varios litros de fertilizantes para combatir las plagas que siempre amenazan la cosecha, le da graciasa a Dios porque con este trabajo que realiza en la siembra de flores a podio salir adelante con su familia y no solo eso si no que tambien se a superado un poco mas economicamente, el deseo de el es seguir cultivando y tener un predio mas grande donde sembrar para superarse un poco mas esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
Santa Fe Ocaña Duo

Ricardo has grown and sold first, second and third quality roses for nine years.  The time for cutting new roses is nearing and he must prepare himself purchasing little bags and grafts to once again plant for the new harvest.  The capital he has is insufficient for this so they need to request a new loan to cover this need he has.  He must also buy several liters of fertilizer to combat pests that always threaten the crop.  

He thanks God because with this work he does growing flowers he’s able to support his family and not only that, he’s actually even gotten a little ahead economically.  He wants to continue growing them and to own a larger parcel of land on which to plant so that he can improve himself still more.   He hopes you will be able to help him with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow roses to sell.

loans.name: Claudia Cecilia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de alimentos, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de un frízer, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para compra de insumos para elaboración de sus alimentos, la Sra. Claudia se siente agradecida con los prestamistas de kiva ya que le ayudaron a crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Sra. Claudia continues in the same business selling food. She notes that she has done well with the previous loan because she used it to purchase a freezer. At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase supplies to prepare her food. Sra. Claudia is grateful to Kiva lenders because they helped her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to prepare food.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a single mother of three children; two of her children go to school. She also takes care of an additional family members (sister). She has a business of a beauty salon, and has been in this business for 4 years.

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more cosmetics, cream relaxers, weaves, and braids. She works from home and sells on a retail basis six days out of every week. She generates additional income through tailoring. Her major business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. 

She is aspiring to own a fully stocked beauty salon and get enough profits to build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to see her business prosper. Her monthly expenses includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, cream relaxers, weaves, and braids.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben, who works alongside his wife, Gilda, is an artisan from Guatemala who specializes in jade jewelry. They would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver for their jewelry.

Ruben and Gilda have been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is their story: 

"Our story begins in a town near Antigua. Gilda grew up in a home of woodcarvers and I grew up in a family of silversmiths. We began our first steps as artisans while still going to school. We met when we were 16 years old; both very young and very much in love. We are artisans who work with our hearts, with dedication and love. 

We greatly appreciate the support you are offering us so we can be ready for Christmas sales. With this money, we plan to buy silver to craft jewelry for the holiday season. We send all of you a big hug and our very best wishes." 

You may view Ruben and Gilda's handcrafted jade jewelry on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/8685

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver to craft jewelry for the holiday season.

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is a 31-year-old married man with three children who owns a house in Kyenjojo,Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for eight years. He started with capital of 70,000 UGX and now has a business worth 3,000,000 UGX. He experiences hardships due to price fluctuation. His vision is to buy a motorcycle to diversify his business and educate his children up to the university level. Vicent intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle for a transport business.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transport business..

loans.name: Samuel Adrian

texts.es:
Samuel es un hombre de 54 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa, el es muy trabajador, entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Samuel no pudo culminar sus estudios primarios y eso lo imposibilito a estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Samuel se dedica a la agricultura, el tiene una pequeña parcela donde siembra plátano, yuca y otros, Samuel trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Samuel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de riego, abono y cosecha de sus cultivos, así pues Samuel seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser reconocido como un buen agricultor.
texts.en:
Samuel is a 54 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa. He is very hard working and enthusiastic and focuses all his efforts on getting ahead. 

Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, and because he had to work, Samuel was not able to finish his elementary education which made it impossible to study to become a professional. 

By his own initiative, Samuel works as a farmer. He has a small plot of land where he grows plantain, yucca and other crops. Samuel works about ten hours a day, every day. 

He believes things are going well for him thanks to his dedication and efforts. 

Samuel is very thankful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to the help given he can cover the costs of irrigation, fertilizer and harvest of his crops. 

This way, Samuel will keep working and making an effort to reach his dream of being known as a good farmer.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs for his crops.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
A Newark native, Kevin says that when he was younger, his father and uncle taught him the landscaping trade and today he still enjoys farming, pruning, and being in nature. 

So after working for a time at Toyota, Kevin started his own landscaping business in the fall of 1994. Along with two other employees, Kevin services businesses, churches, and schools, providing spring and fall clean up, among a variety of other services. Kevin travels as far as Woodbridge to Montclair and has clients all throughout the state.

His business, Kevin says, is to serve the community. The company offers competitive prices and quality service. His customer base, now over 200 people, has been obtained through word of mouth, as Kevin's business has no online presence yet.

This loan will go toward repair and general maintenance of equipment, such as trucks and lawnmowers. Kevin's plan for the business is to “go green” and use organic fertilization, mosquito spray, seeding. His goal is to continue to serve the communities in New Jersey.

loans.use: To repair and maintain equipment

loans.name: Laureta

texts.en:
Laureta is 55 years old and lives in Balintawak, Pagadian City. She is widowed with two children.                     

Laureta has a sari-sari business that sells groceries. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store. She wants to have enough stock to gain more sales.                                            

Laureta has been a member of Paglaum for six years. In the future, Laureta hopes to have mini grocery store.

loans.use: To buy additional inventory for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Eliphaz

texts.en:
Eliphaz is a 43-year-old married man with fifteen children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for thirteen years, and he started the business in order to supplement his farming activities, which are seasonal and highly affected by unpredictable weather changes.

A good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University. Price fluctuations and high cost of rent pose a challenge to his business growth, while his dream is to trade in wholesale. Eliphaz intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise, such packed juice and steel wire, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as packed juice and steel wire, to sell.

loans.name: Ava

texts.en:
For years, Ava has followed her passion as a hair stylist, with a clientele from Manhattan to DC. In a creative move inspired by, of all things, food trucks, Ava decided to put her business on wheels. She purchased and began outfitting a commercial van into a mobile hair salon. It has everything you’d expect from a traditional brick-and-mortar salon, but with added convenience for her busy clients. 

Ava’s family is excited for this next step in her career, and her daughter has even pitched in and designed an eye-catching logo for her van. Ava will use this loan to install equipment in her mobile hair salon.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a mobile hair salon

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Hawa.  She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 12. 

In 2011, Hawa established her drinks, VCD, and audio cassette business. She started the business to help the husband with the education of the children. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 793,762.5 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 3,000,000. Hawa requires a loan to increase the stock on drinks. 

She hopes that this loan will help her to improve the stock and raise the profit. 

In the future, Hawa plans to start a provisions business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Mariama.  She is married and has four children, ages 18, 15, 12 and 8. She has two additional dependents who live with her because of schooling.  

In 1999, Mariama established her provisions business. She began her business for self empowerment. Her business is located at the city centre, and her main customers are both men and women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy provisions. 

She hopes this loan will increase her income level and hence her standard of living. 

In the future, Mariama plans to complete the construction of her house and to educate her children. She appreciates the gesture she is receiving from Kiva. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells provisions (canned foods, sugar, detergents, etc.) and soft drinks at Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has been educated till the end of middle school form 1. She is married and has five children. Her husband is a farmer. Esther has been working in this enterprise for 10 years. She supports her husband in paying the family's utility bills and their children's school fees. 

Her loan will be used to increase her current stock levels. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to grow her provisions and soft drinks enterprise and increase her capital base. In the long run, she wants to expand her business by selling in neighboring villages.

loans.use: to increase her current stock levels.

loans.name: Yesenia Natali

texts.es: Yesenia de 24 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 5 años. Yesenia se dedica a la venta de carne de res desde hace mucho tiempo y de esta forma colabora con la economía de su hogar. Su compañero de vida es albañil y le colabora con los gastos del hogar. Juntos han logrado construir una pequeña casa la cual necesita algunas reparaciones. Las paredes de la casa de Yesenia son de adobe y con el tiempo y las lluvias se han deteriorado por lo que es necesario cambiarlas. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena y hierro para cambiar la pared lo antes posible ya que las que tiene se están cayendo.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 24-years-old and lives in a house that she owns with her life partner and her little 5-year-old. 
Yesenia has been selling beef for a long and by doing this; she has been able to contribute to the economic situation at her home.

Her life partner is a builder and helps with the household expenses. They have built a small house together which needs some repairs.
The walls of Yesenia's house are made out of adobe. The weather and rain have caused some damages. As a result, they will need to repair some areas. 

She is applying for the FUSAI loan so that she can invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, and iron to change the wall as soon as possible since it is collapsing.

loans.use: To purchase brick, cement, sand, and iron to repair the wall of the home.

loans.name: Mohamed E.

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Mohamed.  He is single and has no children; he has one additional dependant, who lives with him to help a younger brother with his schooling. 

In 2011, Mohamed established his pure water business. He began his business to be self reliant after dropping out of school. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1.084,200 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 to buy water processing equipment. 

He hopes this loan will help him to increase the stock and expand the business. 

In the future, Mohamed hopes to improve the business and expand to other towns.. He started the business as a sales representative, now owns his business. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy water processing equipment.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Martha.  She is married and has two children, ages 5 and 13; she has one additional dependant, who lives with her to help a sister with her education. 

In 2011, Martha established her food and drinks business. She began her business to be self reliant after graduating from catering school. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about Le 976,680 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy rice and drinks. 

Martha has already received and successfully repaid one loan. She hopes this loan will help her to improve the stock and raise the profit. 

In the future, Martha plans to expand the business to the center of town. She started the business selling food to office workers, and now has a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for rice and drinks

loans.name: Mark

texts.en:
This is forty-five year-old Mark. He is married, and has four children aged three, seven, ten, and fourteen. He has two additional dependents, who live with him to assist a late brother with the education of his children.  

In 1997, Mark established his used clothing business. He began his business to be self-reliant. His business is located in the city center and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 2,986,950 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mark requires a loan in order to purchase office jackets, trousers, and shirts. He hopes that this loan will help him to increase his stock and expand the business. In the future, Mark plans to to improve the business and expand to other areas of the town.. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy men's jackets and trousers

loans.name: January

texts.en: January is a 33-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. For three years, he has been selling clothes, and he started the business after realizing that farming alone could not enable him to meet his family's daily expenses, since farming is seasonal. Ever changing customer preferences and inadequate capital affect his business profits, while his desire is to own a fashion house. January is requesting a loan to buy clothes to sell ahead of the Christmas season when he expects a big sale.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.name: Maria Genoveva

texts.es:
María, es una señora que desde muy joven emprendió un negocio junto a su madre de venta de elotes y tamales, hoy en día ella trabaja de forma independiente, 
Con el capital comprara elotes tiernos, con esto ella tendrá la materia prima que necesita para seguir trabajando de forma constante, tendrá mejores ventas, aumentaran sus ingresos con los que apoyara más en los gastos de su casa y pagara puntualmente sus cuotas.
Anhela cancelar por completo sus deudas y poder tener un negocio que sea rentable para ya poder trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
María started a business selling corn and tamales with her mother when she was very young; today, she works for herself. 

María will use this capital to buy sweet corn. With that purchase, she will have the raw material she needs to keep working continuously. Her sales will be better, and with the increased earnings, she will contribute more to her household expenses and make her loan payments on time. 

She dreams of completely paying off her debt and being able to have a profitable business so that she can have her own capital to work with.

loans.use: to buy sweet corn

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina operates a soft drink and a cold store at Mpohor (near Takoradi). Georgina is a divorcee with four children. She has been in this business for the past 12 years. As the sole breadwinner of the family, she uses her income to provide for the entire family.

Georgina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, fish, chicken, etc., thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. As a middle school leaver, she understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, thus she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that all her children remain in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of soft drinks, fish, chicken, etc., thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Even though Mary grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, she is an entrepreneur. She sells food stuff, such as yams, cassava and maize, at Mpohor (near Takoradi). Her business has grown substantially since she began 6 years ago. Mary is married and has four children. Her husband is a pensioner.

The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay for their children’s school fees. Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory level, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams, maize and cassava. In the long term, she plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory level, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of yams, maize and cassava.

loans.name: Subba

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Subba.  He is married, and has four children ages 1, 4, 6, and 10; he has one additional dependant, who lives with him to help with the house chores. 

In 1994, Subba established his used bag business. He began his business to be self reliant after coming from the village. His business is located in the city center, and his main customers are adults. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,273,500 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 to buy school bags. 

Subba has already received and successfully repaid five loans.  He hopes this loan will help him increase the stock and expand the business. 

In the future, Subba hopes to improve the business and expand to a shop. He started the business hawking, and now has a stall. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for school bags

loans.name: Zepher

texts.en:
Zepher is a 38-year-old married man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been operating a retail shop for 13 years, and with the proceeds he has been able to start a bar, venture into the transport business, and buy land for farming. Good father that he is, he desires to educate his children up to the University, and also build a permanent house for residence.

Price fluctuation and inadequate capital affect his business profits, while his desire is to trade in wholesale.

Zepher intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise to sell, such as soap and match boxes.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and match boxes to sell.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Alberta is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling yams and fish at Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. Alberta is married and has four children. Her husband operates a soft drink spot. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay for their children’s school fees. 

She will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of yams and fish, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alberta plans to further diversify the type of products she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of yams and fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Georgina did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Georgina sells doughnuts and provisions at Mpohor (near Takoradi). She has been doing this business for about 12 years. She is married to a driver, and together they have four children. She uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Georgina will use the loan to purchase an increased quantity of flour, sugar, oil, etc., which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of flour, sugar, oil, etc., which will aid her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.en:
Emilio is a 49-year-old married man with seven children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a drug shop business for 20 years. He started the business after realizing that his meager salary could hardly meet his family's basic needs. 

High license fees and inadequate capital to meet the overwhelming demand for drugs pose a challenge to his business growth, while his dream is to set up a community hospital. He also desires to educate his children up to university. Emilio is requesting for a loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with five children, and three of her children go to school. She has a business of a restaurant, and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, chicken, ground nuts, beans, and rice. She works at the market five days out of every week, and sells on a retail basis only.

Her major business challenges include thieves, seasonality, and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully stocked restaurant and build her own house. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO to get additional capital for her business. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, beef, chicken, ground nuts, and rice.

loans.name: Luis Cleotilde

texts.es: Luis de 30 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo de 9 años de edad. Desde hace 5 años trabaja como carpintero y gracias a su carisma  y dedicación en lo que hace ya cuanta con muchos clientes que demandan sus servicios. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su casa para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, lámina galvanizada y madera ya que desea cambiar el techo del corredor de su casa y encementar el piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra. Expresa tener la capacidad para cancelar las cuotas que el préstamo implica.
texts.en:
Luis, 30, lives in his own house with his life partner and his young child, age 9.  He has worked as a carpenter for five years.  Thanks to his charisma and dedication to his work he has a lot of customers who request his services.

Luis wants to improve the condition of his house so he's requesting this loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, galvanized metal sheets, and wood.  He wants to change the roof on the porch of his house and cement the floor, which is currently made of dirt.

He says he's able to make the loan payments.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies

loans.name: Fideri

texts.en:
Fideri used the previous loan to pay for labor. He is 31 year-s old and married, with two children, living in Kasese, Uganda. 

He has been in the agriculture business for ten years and works 12 hours a day. He also rears pigs and goats for additional income. 

Fideri intends to use the loan to buy pesticides for his farm.  He dreams of expanding his farm despite challenges of unpredictable weather and inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for his farm.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 27-year-old Mariama from Waterloo2 Eastern area in Freetown. She is married with two children, 3 years and 7 years old. She was a house wife; she began her business because she wanted to create her daily survival contribution to the home. In 2000, Mariama established her assorted drinks business.  She works at the business 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that at present her business is doing well.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase a variety of assorted drinks and Pure Water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future, Mariama plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of assorted drinks and Pure Water.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph has a cocoa business.  He lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  He is 47 years old, and he has eight children; four of them go to school.

Apart from dealing in cocoa selling, he carries out farming as an additional source of income.

Joseph is requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell. He started his cocoa business since 1995. He sells it to cocoa agents in the area.  He hopes to expand his business, despite inadequate capital.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Sohail

texts.en:
Sohail is a 35-year-old married man and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, living in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. His wife is a very hardworking and responsible housewife who always helps her husband in the running of the shop. 

Since 2001, Sohail has been running school stationary shop and books stall which is the only source of income for his family. Currently he needs to purchase more books and stationary equipment for next year to continue his shop, but due to financial constraints he finds it difficult. For that reason, he has requested a loan amount of 150,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan. This will not only help him to grow his shop but will increase his net income and savings as well. 

He desires to provide quality education to his children. He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase more books and stationary equipment

loans.name: Refugio Group

texts.en:
The meeting of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Refugio Group” meaning “Refuge Group” takes place each month in a neighborhood of Quetzaltenango in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. The nine ladies in the group chose this name because they consider the Trust Bank a place to learn, to share, to participate, and to seek support. The ladies are optimistic, enthusiastic, and beautiful in their colorful and traditional outfits that are representative of the area. The women have an average of 2.7 years of education, and their families average four children. The ladies are involved in various economic activities such as the sale of clothing, the weaving of typical regional costumes, and animal husbandry. One of the members has a small store.

Gladys is a 40-year-old married member of the group with four children who range in age from 8 to 19. They are her treasures and the “light of her eyes”. Like some families in the community, her family is involved with weaving of typical skirts called “cortes”. Currently, Gladys has four employees and because of their assistance, she is able to meet the demand for each week. She has applied for a new loan with Friendship Bridge which she will use to buy a variety of good quality yarn. Gladys is very happy to have this working capital because she will have more material to work with and therefore, more income.

The nine women, along with their families, appreciate the opportunity to secure a loan which ultimately benefits everyone in their families since many of the businesses are family businesses. They also look forward to their monthly educational trainings on topics like sales and promotion, savings and indebtedness, medicinal plants, and healthy meals. Armed with their loans and information from their educational trainings, these women look forward to the future where empowered women will eliminate poverty.

loans.use: To buy a variety of good quality yarn to make clothes.

loans.name: Eleni

texts.en:
Eleni is a 41 year old married woman with three children. 

She has a small plantation and grows cabbages to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Eleni has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, shovels, a crowbar, seeds, and sprayers. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Eleni hopes to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, shovels, a crowbar, seeds, and sprayers

loans.name: Ukux Kem Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank, “Ukux Kem” or “Heart of Weaving” is well-organized and strives every day to improve the well-being of their families. Sometimes it is a struggle, but they persevere because they know that a better future lies ahead for themselves and their families. The loans funded by Kiva investors and the educational trainings that they receive from Friendship Bridge are a vital key to their success. They are proud of their accomplishments.

The ten ladies of the Trust Bank recently completed a loan cycle with Friendship Bridge.

These loans were generously funded by Kiva investors. The women appreciate the generosity of Kiva investors. The ladies are truly honored that people from all parts of the world believe that the women of “Ukux Kem” can progress with the proper tools. Because of the success of the previous loan cycle, the group is requesting a new loan from Friendship Bridge funded by Kiva investors.

The Ukux Kem Trust Bank is aptly named, as the ladies weave and sell textiles like tablecloths, napkins and traditional shirts or “huipiles”, as well as the traditional skirts or “cortes”.  Juana is a 59-year-old mother of five children and is widowed. She joined Friendship Bridge around five years ago. Juana was greatly relieved when she first found out that she was eligible for a loan, which she is using in her textile manufacturing business. 

She will use the funds to produce more textiles such as the beautiful, traditional skirts called “cortes”, tablecloths and napkins. As the high-selling part of the year is approaching in November and December, Juana has requested a new loan, which she will use to purchase quality thread and yarn in bulk. She employs one of her children, and the pair work hard to make enough income to support the family. Juana makes delivery of her products at least twice per month. Because of her efforts, she is pleased to make her monthly loan payments on time and support her family.

Juana, along with the other members of the Trust Bank, are actively involved in the monthly educational training programs offered by Friendship Bridge. It is essential that the loans that the women receive be combined with these trainings that cover topics like business administration and indebtedness, women’s and children’s nutrition and health, as well as self-esteem.

loans.use: to purchase quality thread and yarn in bulk.

loans.name: Siala

texts.en:
Siala is 40 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Siala has requested a loan to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, plates, and cooking oil. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Siala will help with her children's education.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, baking powder, plates, and cooking oil

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 33 years old and married, with two children. 

She runs a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living; she's been doing this for many years. 

Caroline has requested a loan to buy chemicals, shovels, crowbars, crops, a backpack sprayer, and a wheelbarrow. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to capital. 

Caroline hopes to save her earnings to pay for her children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, shovels, crowbars, taro crops, a backpack sprayer, and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Tuaoi

texts.en:
Tuaoi is 56 years old and divorced, with six children. 

She has a small business selling well-sewn dresses. She has many years with this business. 

Tuaoi needs a loan to buy material, a sewing machine, needles, thread, and zippers. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. 

Tuaoi joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, a sewing machine, needles, thread, and zippers

loans.name: Leutogi

texts.en:
Leutogi is 26 years old and married with three children. She makes and sells traditional printed material (elei) to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. 

Leutogi has requested a loan to buy material, stencils, paint, brushes, and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD this year to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, stencils, paint, brushes, and rollers

loans.name: Faalo

texts.en:
Faalo is 23 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Faalo has requested a loan to buy baking powder, sugar, cooking oil, pots, a frying pan and plates. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faalo hopes to secure a better future for her children.

loans.use: to buy baking powder, sugar, cooking oil, pots, a frying pan, and plates

loans.name: Gidda

texts.en:
Gidda is married with two children, one of whom goes to school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin). 

She has a business of selling cosmetics and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of Vaseline, cream relaxers and hair oils. 

Gidda moves door to door selling cosmetics six days out of every week and sells to all categories of people at retail. Her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing prices of cosmetics in Uganda. She aspires to get a permanent business premises and also to build rental rooms. 

She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of the low interest charged. She resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees for her cousins and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of Vaseline, cream relaxers and hair oils.

loans.name: Micheal

texts.en: Micheal used a previous loan to buy stationery to sell. He is a 31-year-old married man with one child, living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been operating a stationery shop for four years and also earns a monthly salary as a teacher. His major clients are students and offices, and so he is assured of business all year round. His challenges include insufficient electricity supply and high labor turnover. His dreams are to own a standby generator and to diversify his businesses to include motorcycle transport. Micheal intends to use the loan to buy papers, books and pens to sell.

loans.use: to buy papers, books and pens to sell.

loans.name: Purificacion

texts.es:
Purificación de 64 años de edad, es casado y tiene 3 hijas, una estudia bachillerato, otra ayuda en su casa con los oficios y la mayor trabaja, además de sus hijas Purificación convive con su esposa que le ayuda en el cuido de las gallinas ponedoras.

Purificación tiene un lote de gallinas ponedoras, tiene 7 años de trabajar en este tipo de negocio; aprendió por iniciativa propia apoyado por su esposa y en vista de los buenos resultados es que tomaran la decisión de producir de lleno.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar insumos para la granja, concentrado vitaminas y medicina, esto le permitirá mantener su producción en óptimas condiciones y poder solventar los gastos de la familia.
En un futuro, espera comprar un medio de trasporte para movilizarse a la ciudad y comprar sus insumos.
texts.en:
Purificación is 64 years old, and lives with his wife and three daughters. Of the daughters, one is in high school, another helps at home, and the oldest works. Purificación's spouse helps him to take care of the egg-laying hens. Purificación has a plot with egg-laying hens, and has been doing this type of work for seven years. He learned the business through his own initiative, supported by his wife, and since he has been successful, they have taken the decision to increase production. 

The loan will be used to purchase supplies for the farm, vitamin-enriched chicken feed, and medicine, which will allow him to maintain optimal conditions for production and thus pay for his family's expenses. In the future, he would like to purchase a means of transport so that he can travel to the city and buy his supplies.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for the farm, vitamin-enriched chicken feed, and medicine.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is married with seven children and only one of her children goes to school. She also takes care of her aunt and three cousins. She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for six months. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She generates additional income through making candles and selling used clothes. She sells charcoal from home and also goes door-to-door selling used clothes. She sells at both retail and wholesale and sells to people seven days a week. Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality. She hopes to sell wholesale and also to get a permanent business premises. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah is married with three children, all of whom go to school. She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for 13 years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity.  

She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids. 

She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis.   Her major business challenges include thieves and seasonality.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked beauty salon and also to educate her children up to university.  

Robinah resides in the family house, and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of cream relaxers, weaves and braids.

loans.name: Fiapapalagi

texts.en:
Fiapapalagi is 25 years old and has two children with her partner. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Fiapapalagi has requested a loan to buy hooks, fishing rods, flippers, goggles, and bait. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fiapapalagi will help pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy hooks, fishing rods, flippers, goggles and bait

loans.name: Otila

texts.en:
Otila is 32 years old and married with two children. She runs a small business selling ice cakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Otila has requested a loan to buy a cooler, cordials, sugar, foam cups, and Chinese candy. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Otila hopes to renew her home.

loans.use: to buy a cooler, cordials, sugar, foam cups and Chinese candy

loans.name: Gauai

texts.en:
Gauai is 29 years old and married, with four children. 

She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Gauai has requested a loan to buy taro crops, fertilizer, chemicals, weedspray, and a chainsaw. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Gauai hopes to help her family's everyday needs and wants.

loans.use: to buy taro crops, fertilizers, chemicals, weedspray, and a chain saw

loans.name: Arely Elizabeth

texts.es:
Arely de 22 años de edad, esta casada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, en casa conviven tres personas.

Arely es ama de casa, y la mayor parte de su tiempo lo dedica a cuidar a su hijo, pero junto con su esposo se están iniciando en actividades de crianza de ganado y especies menores como cerdos y aves; pues creen que son una buena alternativa para mantener una familia.

El préstamo será utilizado, para comprar una vaca productora de leche, principalmente para el consumo familiar. En un futuro espera ver a su hijo con un  titulo profesional, espera aumentar las ganancias comprando mas ganado y algún día tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Arely, 22, is married with a one-year-old son.  Three people live together.  Arely’s a housewife and spends most of her time caring for her son but she and her husband are starting a business raising cattle and small species like pigs and fowl for they believe it’s a good alternative for family support.

The loan will be used to buy a dairy cow to produce milk primarily for family consumption.  In future, she hopes her son will earn a professional degree.  She hopes to increase profits buying more cattle and someday to own a house.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Norma Estela

texts.es:
Norma de 40 años,  es madre de tres hijos: una hija de 19 años que está casada y no vive con ellos, un varón que posee 15 años, que estudia 9ª grado y una niña de 8 años de edad que estudia, segundo grado. Esta acompañada y él se dedica a trabajar en la reparación de motocicletas.

Ellos poseen el taller de motocicletas en la case de ellos (garaje) y funciona desde este  año, él se encarga de la reparación con ayuda de su hijo y ella de llevar el control y la venta de repuestos. 

Compra de contado los repuestos, en las casas distribuidoras de diferentes marcas de motocicletas y vende con los clientes del taller. 

El préstamo servirá para adquirir mercadería nueva, que se ofrecen como buenas ofertas en esta temporada por la liquidación de las empresas. Al capitalizarse, se ampliarán sus inventarios, mejorando su capacidad de oferta a sus clientes.

Espera, mantenerse en el negocio con el taller de motocicletas y en un futuro abrir un nuevo centro de servicio, esto cuando su hijo cumpla la mayoría de edad.
texts.en:
Norma is 40 years old and is the mother of 3 children: a daughter aged 19 who is married and does not live with them, a boy aged 15 who is in 9th grade at school and a girl of 8 years of age who is at school in second grade. Norma has a partner and he works in motorcycle repairs.

They have a motorcycle repair workshop in their home (garage) which started running this year. Norma's partner looks after the repairs with the help of his son and she does the auditing and sales of spare parts.

They buy the spares in cash from the distribution centres of the various makes of motorcycle and sell them to the workshop's customers.

The loan will be used to buy new stock, which is available at good discounts at this time of year because of businesses having clearance sales. By capitalising on this, they will increase their stock inventory, improving their supply capacity for their customers.

She hopes they can stay in business with the motorcycle workshop and hopes to open a new service centre in the future, when her son comes of age.

loans.use: to buy new stock, which is available at good discounts at this time of year because of businesses having clearance sales.

loans.name: Secundino

texts.es:
Secundino de 48 años, es una persona que vive con su esposa, con quien ha pasado momentos felices como tristes uno de los más difíciles, fue la noticia que les dieron que por cosas de la vida, no podrían tener hijos; para poder formar una familia y ver sus hijos crecer, fue algo muy triste dice Secundino; pero a pesar de eso siguen adelante, y tratan la manera de vivir feliz juntos los dos. Porque, dice tener una esposa muy buena que lo apoya en lo que sea y gracias a ese apoyo ha sabido vivir la vida de la mejor manera.

Secundino, es una persona muy trabajadora, que a pesar de los malos momentos vividos con su esposa ha luchado para salir adelante, y poder vivir de la mejor manera y es así como con iniciativa propia, implemento una pequeña tienda, donde ya tiene 7 años de trabajarla en casa donde vive y es de donde obtiene unos ingresos para su esposa y él. 

También tiene ingresos de los trabajos agrícolas, donde tiene ya 30 años de cultivar la tierra. Cuando implemento la tienda no tenía ninguna experiencia, pero con el apoyo de su esposa quien le administra los recursos, y como es la único miembro de su familia se apoyan mutuamente para salir adelante.

El dinero será destinado, para la compra de productos para surtir la tienda donde comprara desde productos lácteos, pan, sodas, granos básicos, arroz, frijoles, azúcar como también golosinas, y más. En eso sería invertido, el dinero que Fundación campo, le ha confiado, y estará mejorando su negocio porque podrá ofrecer más productos a los clientes y con eso se tendrá mayores ingresos para su hogar, la necesidad ha sido cubierta, por que lo principal era surtir su tienda y seguir adelante con su negocio.

 Lo que más quiere él, es poder tener al menos un hijo para compartir momentos felices, aunque lo ve difícil; pero confía en Dios le ayudara, en su negocio, piensa continuar invirtiendo para ser una de las mejores tiendas surtidas en el catónn donde vive y así poder servirle mejor a los clientes.
texts.en:
Secundino, 48, is a man living with his wife with whom he’s spent happy and sad moments.  One of the most difficult was when they were given the news that due to life’s vicissitudes they would never have children.  Crespín says that not forming a family and seeing their children grow was a very sad thing.  But despite that they continue forward and try to find the way to live happily just the two of them.  He says that he has a good wife that supports him in everything and thanks to that support he’s learned to live life to the fullest.

Secundino’s a very hardworking man who despite the bad times shared with his wife has striven to get ahead a be able to live the best way possible.  This is how on his own initiative he opened a small store that he’s now had for 7 years.  It’s home-based and earns income to support him and his wife.

He also earns income working in agriculture where he’s been cultivating the soil for 30 years.  When he opened the store he had no experience but with his wife’s support who manages the resources and is the only member of his family they support each other mutually to get ahead.

The money will be used to buy stock merchandise for the store such as dairy products, bread, sodas, basic grains, rice, beans, snacks and more.  This is what the money Fundación Campo has entrusted to them will be used for.  It will improve the business for he will be able to offer more products to customers and this will lead to higher household income.  The need has been met because his main goal was to stock the store and continue forward with his business.

What he wants most is to have at least one son to share happy moment with though he sees this as being difficult but he trusts that God will help him in his business.  He plans to continue investing to become one of the best stocked stores in the canton he live in to be able to better serve his customers.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Oscar Arturo

texts.es:
Oscar de 38 años, es bachiller, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos, los 2 estudian. 

Él tiene una carpintería desde hace unos 12 años, un tío le enseño desde que estaba pequeño, antes era estudiante;  pero por las tardes laboraba en la carpintería del tío, fue donde aprendió el oficio.  Oscar todos los días viaja a una distancia de 5 kilómetros, lo hace en bus porque en bicicleta o a pie es muy peligroso, llega a su trabajo a las 7:00 am y regresa a su casa a las 5:00 pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para pagar por el proceso de escrituración, ya que su suegro le heredo a la hija la propiedad donde viven y ya quiere que este todo legal para instalar el agua y luz propia.

Su deseo es, que sus hijos puedan vivir cómodamente en su casa y que nadie los moleste, pretende que sus hijos estudien y vayan a la universidad, poco a poco lo ira logrando, el préstamo ahorita es de gran ayuda, porque legalizara su casa y posteriormente instalara un taller en su casa.
texts.en:
Oscar, 38, is a high-school graduate.  His wife does domestic chores and he has two children attending school.  He has had a carpentry shop for about 12 years.  An uncle taught him when he was still a boy.  He used to be a student but worked in his uncle’s carpentry shop afternoons and learned his skill there.  Oscar travels a distance of 5 kilometers daily by bus because walking or biking is very dangerous and arrives at work at 7am to return home at 5pm.

The loan he’s requesting is to pay  property title transfer costs because his father-in-law bequeathed the property they live in to his wife and he wants everything to be legal so he can have water and electricity installed.

His wish is that his children can live comfortably at home with no one bothering them.  He intends his children to study and attend university and he’s attaining this little by little.  The loan right now is of great help because he’ll legalize his house and later on set up a workshop at home.

loans.use: to pay property title transfer costs.

loans.name: Olga Elizabet

texts.es:
Olga de 51 años,  estudio hasta bachillerato, está acompañada; su compañero de vida trabaja en la agricultura tiene un hijo el cual no vive con ella, solamente vive con el esposo.

Ella se dedica a la venta de pasteles, quesadillas etc., el negocio lo tiene desde hace cinco meses, una amiga le dio  la idea del negocio y fue así como ella empezó hacer  los clientes, el trabajo lo realiza en su casa y vende con sus vecinos.

Con el crédito comprara ropa para comercializarla en la comunidad,  piensa que le ayudara para incrementar los ingresos a la familia, ya que podrá obtener mejores ganancias 


Piensa mejorar la casa, para que su hijo viva mejor y que sea un profesional, pretende ser  mejor cada día y las ganancias la invertirá en más producto para ir aumentando los negocios.
texts.en:
Olga is 51-years old.  She finished high school and is married.  Her husband works in agriculture.  They have one son who does not live with them; Olga lives alone with her husband.  

Olga makes her living selling baked goods, quesadillas etc.  She has had the business for five months.  A friend gave her the idea to start the business , which is how she started getting customers.  She works out of her house and sells to her neighbors. 

With the loan, Olga will purchase clothing to re-sell in her community.  She thinks it will help to increase her family's income, as she will be able to earn a better profit. 

Olga plans to make improvements to her home so that her son can have a better quality of life and a career.  She hopes to improve her business each day and invest the profits in more products to keep growing her businesses.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Siaulaina

texts.en:
Siaulaina is a 41-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Siaulaina has requested a loan to buy taro and banana crops, weed spray, chemicals, barbed wire and a wheelbarrow. She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Siaulaina hopes to improve her business and better her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy taro crops, banana crops, weed spray, chemicals, barbed wire and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Noatia

texts.en:
Noatia is 39 years old and married with six children. She runs a small business selling German buns in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Noatia has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, oil, coconuts and a gas burner. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Noatia will improve/extend her business and provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy sacks flour, sugar, coconuts, yeast, oil and a gas burner

loans.name: Lisa

texts.en:
Lisa is a 49-year-old woman who is married with 10 children. She has a small business making and selling pancakes. To earn extra income, she also makes ice cakes. 

Lisa needs a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, foam cups, dripping oil and plastic bags. She will use her profits to extend/improve her business. Lisa joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sacks flour, sugar, yeast, dripping oil, boxes of foam cups and plastic bags

loans.name: Simalu

texts.en:
Simalu is 41 years old and married, with four children. 

She has a small plantation and grows ava (kava) to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. 

Simalu has requested a loan to buy fertilizers, a chain saw, chemicals, weed-spray, and plastic bags. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Simalu hopes to extend and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, a chain saw, chemicals, weed-spray, and plastic bags

loans.name: Poto

texts.en:
Poto is 77 years old and a widow, with four children. 

She has a small business, Elei Printing. To earn extra income, she also has a second business, Ice Cakes. 

Poto needs a loan to buy a chest freezer, foam cups, materials, paints, rollers, paint brushes, and Chinese lollies. She will use her profits to extend and improve her business. 

Poto joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy materials, paints, rollers, paint brushes, a chest freezer, foam cups, and Chinese lollies

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, trabaja en un pequeña empresa panadera. Actualmente vive con su hijo de 15 años, su compañero de vida y ambos aportan para los gastos de la familia.

María tiene 5 años de experiencia en la actividad de hacer pan, actividad que la aprendió cuando recibió talleres sobre actividades productivas. Además desarrolla el rol de madre de familia y espera otro miembro en la familia, ya que tiene 4 meses de embarazo.

Con el préstamo se le estará ayudando, para que pueda solventar algunas deudas que tiene en otras instituciones, que la dejan sin efectivo y ella quiere ayudar más en la familia y gracias al financiamiento tendrá más dinero, disponible para darle una mejor vida a su hijo y al próximo que espera.

María quiere, en un futuro no muy lejano mejorar su vivienda, ya que no está en muy buenas condiciones y quiere que sus hijos tengan una mejor vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria is 34 years old and she is a hard-working woman that works in a small bakery. She lives with her 15 year-old son and her husband, and together they pay the household expenses.

Maria has worked for 5 years in the bread-making business, an activity that she learned when she attended workshops about productive activities.  Later, she developed into the role of mother of her family and she hopes for another child. She now is 4 months pregnant.

With this loan, she will get the help she needs to pay off some of her debts to other creditors.  She wants to help her family and thanks to this loan, she will have more money available to provide a better life for her son and the next child that's on the way.

Maria dreams about a near future in which she improves her home, since it is in bad condition, and she wants to provide her children with better living conditions.

loans.use: para pagar una deuda en otra institución financiera.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson, aged 39, is married with eight children (19, 17, 15, 13, 11, 9, 7, and 5). He pays school fees for his four school-going children and two orphans live with him as dependants. He works in the agriculture industry growing tea, tomatoes and beans.

He has approached Ugafode for a loan of 1,000,000 to improve on his agricultural activities by buying mulch and manure to enhance productivity.

His dream is to grow his business so that he can he can raise enough income to look after his family.

He faces challenges of seasonality and yet he has no other sources of income.

loans.use: to buy mulch and manure to enhance productivity.

loans.name: Goar

texts.en:
Goar is a 30-year-old married woman. She lives in a small village of Tsalka district with her husband and three children. 

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where they grow potatoes and cabbages. Goar and her husband work hard, and they always have high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers. 

Goar decided to start a family business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $2,000 for opening a building materials shop. With the received credit, she will purchase a stock of building materials to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to open a building materials shop.

loans.name: Level

texts.en:
Level is a 22-year-old living with her partner and her 2 children.

She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Level has requested a loan to buy water gallon, wheelbarrow, bush knives, barbed wire and crowbar.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Level hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy water gallon, wheelbarrow, bushknives, barbed wire and crowbar

loans.name: Saiauta

texts.en:
Saiauta is 21 years old and single with one child. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Saiauta has requested a loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, yeast, dripping oil and a gas burner. She joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Saiauta will extend/improve her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks flour, sugar, yeast, dripping oil and a gas burner

loans.name: Salu

texts.en:
Salu is a 43-year-old woman who is married with 12 children. She has a small business providing taxi services. She has been in this business for many years. 

Salu needs a loan to buy sets of tires, seat covers, petrol, paint and related items. She will use her profits to extend her business and to save for her grandchildren's education. Salu joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy sets of tires, seat covers, petrol and paint

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 34-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She has a small fishing business. To earn extra income, she also grows a vegetable garden. 

Rowena needs a loan to buy spears, a diving suit, flippers, vegetable seeds, barbed wire and shovels. She will use her profits to extend/improve her business. Rowena joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy spears, a diving suit, flippers, vegetable seeds, barbed wire and shovels

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José de 59 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposa desde hace 22 años. Sus condiciones habitacionales son muy sencillas y poco a poco va mejorando para dar a su esposa mayor comodidad y seguridad. José ha trabajado como albañil desde hace 20 años y de esta forma ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. Su deseo es mejorar el techo de su casa ya que por las lluvias se ha deteriorado y el agua se filtra cuando llueve. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos y dar solución a este problema lo antes posible.
texts.en:
José, age 59, has lived in his own house with his wife for 22 years.  His living conditions are very simple.  Little by little, he is improving them in order to make his wife more comfortable and safer.
